en: He has actually relaxed the numbers for gatherings and religious gatherings and that is a potential risk.
tsn: O tlogetse palo ya dikokoano le dikokoano tsa sedumedi mme seo ke kotsi e kgolo

en: As long as they follow precautions I think that’s the key thing.
tsn: Fela fa e le gore ba latela dikgato, ke akanya gore seo  ke selo se se botlhokwa.

en: So it really comes down to individuals taking responsibility, individual church leaders following protocols.
tsn: Ka jalo e boela morago mo bathong gore ba tsaye maikarabelo, baeteledipele ba kereke ba latelang ditaelo.

en: Stead adds: I’m concerned about on-site alcohol consumption.
tsn: Stead o tlaleletsa ka gore: Ke tshwenyegile ka Thekiso ya nnotagi kwa mafelong a go nna.

en: From the hospital perspective, there is no doubt that when people are drinking they [are] not social distancing.
tsn: Go tswa ponong ya bookelong, ga go na pelaelo ya gore fa batho ba nwa ga ba [ba]  kgone go katologana.

en: Their masks are off.
tsn: Ba tlhobola dithibanko le molomo tsa bona

en: Pubs and shebeens are probably the places where social distancing happens the least.
tsn: Diphapo le dišebini e ka nna mafelo a go katologana go diriwang go le gonnye.

en: We are concerned that its likely that alcohol is going to be flowing fairly freely during Easter and that we may see a couple of weeks later COVID-19 numbers increasing.
tsn: Re tshwenyegile gore go na le kgonagalo ya gore nnotagi e tla bo e nwewa  bonolo fela ka nako ya Paseka mme re tla bona palo ya Khorona e oketsega morago ga dibeke di le mmalwa.

en: President Cyril Ramaphosa has paid tribute to legendary news anchor Noxolo Grootboom, who presented her last news bulletin on Tuesday evening after 37 years.
tsn: Moporesidente Cyril Ramaphosa o lebogile mogaka wa mmega dikgang Noxolo Grootboom, yo o neng a buisa dikgang la bofelo mo maitseboeng a Labobedi morago ga dingwaga di le 37.

en: Earlier, the presidency postponed the President’s address to the nation on the COVID-19 Easter weekend restrictions by half an hour to allow South Africans to watch Grootboom do what she does best for the last time.
tsn: Le gale, ofisi ya Moporesidente e buseditse puo ya setšhaba ya Moporesidente morago mo go kiletso ya bofelo jwa beke ya Paseka ka ga Khorona ka seripa sa ura e le nngwe go letla maAforika Borwa go bogela Grootboom  a dire se a se dirang go gaisa la bofelo.

en: Ramaphosa says the news anchor was outstanding in her service to the nation.
tsn: Ramaphosa a re mmega dikgang yo o ne a dira tirelo e ntle mo setšhabeng.

en: I wish to pay tribute to Miss Grootboom as an outstanding journalist who throughout her 37 years of distinguished service bought historic events in our country and across the world into the living rooms our nation.
tsn: Ke rata go akgola Mohumagatsana Grootboom jaaka mmegadikgang yo o gaisang yo nako yotlhe ya gagwe ya dingwaga di le 37 a dira tirelo  e e kwa godimo a tlisa meletlo ya hisetori ya rona ya mo nageng le go ralala lefatshe lotlhe mo diphaposing tsa rona.

en: We wish Miss Grootboom well and thank her for her many years service, he added.
tsn: Re rata gape go leboga Mohumagatsana Grootboom sentle le go leboga tirelo ya gagwe ya dingwaga di le dintsi, a tlaleletsa.

en: Grootboom has been trending on social media with many South Africans wishing her well in her retirement.
tsn: Go ne go buiwa ka Grootboom mo mafaratlhatlheng le  MaAforika Borwa a mantsi a mo lakaletsa masego mo go roleng tiro ga gawe.

en: Her colleagues have also bid farewell to the news icon who is best known for her sign off, ndinithanda nonke emakhaya.
tsn: Badirammogo ba gagwe ba  laetse sentle segaka sa mmegi dikgang yo o neng a  itsege thata ka polelo ya go tswala, ke le rata lotlhe kwa magaeng

en: A farewell fit for a queen.
tsn: Tsamaiso e ntle go Kgosigadi.

en: Imagine one day telling your children: One day long ago, the president at the time wanted to talk to Mzansi, but then he moved his time so that your gogo, the TV Queen of News, could first read her TV news bulletin one final time on the public broadcaster.
tsn: Akanya ka letsatsi le le lengwe o tlhalosetsa bana ba gago: ka letsatsi le le lengwe, , moporesidente wa nako eo o ne a batla go bua le Mzansi, fela o ne a diegisa nako ya puo gore nkoko wa gago, Kgosigadi ya bobegakgang, a ka bega dikgang tsa telebishene lwa bofelo mo kgasong ya bosetshaba.

en: You are a legend.
tsn: O mogaka.

en: Its not just what you have done behind that camera for over 30 years, it is also your beautiful heart.
tsn: Ga se gore o dirile ka fa morago ga khamera go feta dingwaga tse 30, gape ke pelo ya gago e ntle.

en: Enjoy retirement but may the nation never actually let you retire. Redi Tlhabi, March 30, 2021
tsn: Itumelele go rola tiro ga gago, mme a setšhaba se sa go letlelele go rola tiro. Redi Tlhabi, Mopitlwe 30, 2021

en: A reassuring voice even in uncertain times.
tsn: lentswe le le gomotsang le ka dinako tse boima.

en: Thank you Mam Noxolo Grootboom.
tsn: Ke a leboga Mme Noxolo Grootboom.

en: You have set the bar high.
tsn: O dirile go tlala seatla.

en: Enjoy your retirement, you have earned it .
tsn: Itumelele go rola tiro ga gao. O dirile ka natla.

en: US first lady Jill Biden is getting her own biographical comic book, joining women like Vice President Kamala Harris, nun Mother Theresa and country star Dolly Parton in TidalWave Comics Female Force series.
tsn: Lekgarebe la ntlha la US Jill Biden o fitlhela buka ya kwalotshelo ya metlae ya gagwe ya ntlha, a latela  basadi ba tshwana le moporesitente wa Vice Kamala Harris, moitlami Mme Theresa le naledi ya naga Dolly Parton mo tlhatlhamong ya buka ya Metlae ya Basadi ba Maatla ya TidalWave

en: The 69-year-old community college educator and author will be the subject of the 22-page Female Force: Jill Biden, which will be released in print and digitally on April 7.
tsn: Morutabana wa kholeji ya setšhaba yo o dingwaga di le 69 gape e le mokwadi o tla nna setlhogo sa buka ya ditsebe di le 22 ya basadi ba dinatla: Jill Biden, e e tlaa gololwang ka kgatiso le mo maratlhatlheng ka la  7 Moranang .

en: A matching colouring book will also be released.
tsn: Buka ya mebala e e nyalelanang le yona e tlaa gololwa.

en: Biden, who has long advocated for military families, community colleges and women’s education, is the latest addition to the biographical comic series, dedicated to inspirational women.
tsn: Biden, yo a neng a tshegetsa masika a sesole, dikholeji tsa baagi le thuto ya basadi, ke tlhatlhamo ya tlaleletso ya bofelo kwalotshelo ya metlae, e e diretsweng go akgola basadi.

en: Previous subjects also include former first lady Michelle Obama, singer Cher and actress Betty White.
tsn: Ditlhogo tsa kwa morago di akaretsa gape lekgarebe la ntlha la maloba Michelle Obama, seopedi Cher le modiragatsi  Betty White.

en: We believe that it is important for readers to have inspiring role models, to learn about extraordinary individuals that have overcome challenges to make a difference in the world, TidalWave Comics said in a statement.
tsn: Re dumela gore go botlhokwa gore babuisi ba nne le seabe sa sekao se se molemo se se rotloetsang, go ithuta ka ga batho ba ba sa tlwaelegang ba ba fentseng  dikgwetlho go dira pharologano mo lefatsheng, TidalWave o buile mo setatamenteng.

en: Menachem Rosensaft, the son of two Holocaust survivors who became an international lawyer specialising in genocide, has spent much of his life trying to reconcile the horrors of the past with his Jewish faith.
tsn: Menachem Rosensaft, morwa wa bafalodi ba matlhotlhapelo ba babedi o a nnileng mmueledi yo o itsegeng boditšhabatšhaba ka go nyaolwa ga batho , o tshetse botshelo jwa gagwe jo bontsi a leka go kopana le masetlapelo a a fetileng le tumelo ya  Bajuta.

en: Rosensaft was born in 1948 in military barracks housing displaced persons, including survivors like his mother of the nearby Bergen-Belsen Nazi concentration camp.
tsn: Rosensaft o belegwe ka ngwaga wa 1948 kwa dikampeng tsa dintlo tsa sesole tsa batho ba ba tlositsweng, go akaretsa le bafalodi ba ba tshwanang le mmagwe wa kwa kampeng e e gaufi ya Bergen-Belsen Nazi.

en: His father survived five camps, including Auschwitz and Bergen-Belsen.
tsn: Rraagwe o tshetse mo dikampeng tse tlhano, go akaretsa le Auschwitz le Bergen-Belsen.

en: Around 50 000 prisoners died at Bergen-Belsen, among them Anne Frank.
tsn: Batshwarwa ba ka nna 50 000 ka palo ba tlhokafaletse kwa Bergen-Belsen, magareng ga bona ke Anne Frank.

en: When British forces freed the camp in 1945, they found some 60 000 survivors, but nearly 14 000 died within two months from disease and malnutrition.
tsn: Fa sesole sa kwa Britain se se ne golola kampa ka ngwaga wa 1945, ba fitlhetse bafalodi ba ka nna 60 000, fela  ba ka nnang 14 000 ba tlhokafatse mo dikgweding di le pedi ka ntlha ya malwetse le tlhokego ya dikotla.

en: Rosensaft, an American, has turned to poetry to reflect in verse not only on the Holocaust but also recent attempts at genocide, such as in Bosnia and Rwanda, and also tackles racism and intolerance.
tsn: Rosensaft, wa Moamerika, o sekametse go poko go tlhagisa ka temana e seng fela mo Matlhotlhapelo fela gape le maiteko a a tswang mo dipolaong, jaaka kwa Bosnia le Rwanda, gape le go itebaganya le kgethololo ya mmala le go itshokela.

en: We know there are neo-Nazi forces, there are white supremacist forces in all parts of the world who, if allowed to, will perpetrate horrific acts, crimes against humanity, genocide against the other, Rosensaft said in a video interview from his home in New Jersey.
tsn: Re a itse gore go na le kgatelelo ya neo-Nazi, go na le kgatelelo ya basweu mo dikarolong tsotlhe tsa lefatshe, ke mang, fa go letleletswe, o tla dirang ditiro tse maswe, bosenyi kgatlhanong le batho, polao kgatlhanong le bangwe, Rosensaft o rile jalo mo kgatisong ya  ditherisano go tswa kwa legaeng la gagwe kwa New Jersey.

en: And the other can be Jews, Roma, Muslims, it can be the immigrant and the LGBTQ community and we all have to be on guard.
tsn: Mme ba bangwe e ka nna MaJuta, MaRoma, maMoseleme, e ka nna batswakwa le setšhaba sa LGBTQ  rotlhe re tshwanetse go nna kelotlhoko.

en: His book of verse, Poems Born in Bergen-Belsen, is being published in April by Kelsay Books to coincide with Yom Hashoah, the Jewish day of remembrance for Holocaust victims on April 9 and the anniversary of the liberation of Bergen-Belsen on April 15, 1945.
tsn: Buka ya gagwe ya temana, maboko a a tshotsweng mo Bergen-Belsen, e phasaladitsweng ka Moranang ke Dibuka tsa Kelsay go tsamaisana le Yom Hashoah, Letsatsi la Bajuta go gopola batswasetlhabelo ba matlhotlhapelo ka Moranang 9 mme segopotso sa kgololosego ya Bergen-Belsen ka Moranang 15, 1945.

en: Rosensaft, who has visited Bergen-Belsen more than 25 times, wrestles in some of the 82 poems with what he called ghosts of those who will not leave places where they were killed.
tsn: Rosensaft, yo a etetseng Bergen-Belsen makgetlho a a fetang 25, o lwana mo mabokong a mangwe a le 82 le se a se bitsang dipoko tsa ba ba ka se tlogeleng mafelo ao ba bolaetsweng go ona

en: I try to figure out in my own head what has happened to them, what are they doing, what is going on with the landscape which they still inhabit because they dont have a cemetery, they dont have a graveyard, he said.
tsn: Ke leka go tlhaloganya ka fa tlhogong ya me ke eng se se ba diragaletseng, ba dira eng,  go diragala eng ka lefatshe leo ba le dutseng  ka gonne ga ba na mabitla, a rialo.

en: Their graveyard is the sky.
tsn: Mabitla a bona ke legodimo

en: He writes of clean-shaven guards humming Mozart as they select who will live and who will die and then ending their shift with a bored smile before dinner.
tsn: O kwala ka mosireletsi yo o segang sentle ditedu a ntse a sumasuma Mozart fa ba tlhopha yo o tla tshelang le yo o tla bolawang morago ba feleletse tiro ya bona ka monyenyo o o bodutu pele ga dijo tsa bosigo.

en: Children inhabit many poems, inspired by his half-brother Benjamin, who at five-and-a-half years old was killed alongside his father and grandparents on arrival at Auschwitz in 1943.
tsn: Bana ba latela maboko a mantsi, o rotloeditswe ke abuti-ka-motsadi Benjamin, yo ka dingwaga di le tlhano le halofo  o ne a bolawa mmogo le rraagwe le bagolo mo go gorogeng kwa Auschwitz ka 1943.

en: As guards herded them to the gas chamber, Benjamin asked his mother if they were going to live or die.
tsn: Fa basireletsi  aba kgoromeletsa kwa diphaposing tsa gase, Benjamin o ne a botsa  mmaagwe gore a ba tlile go tshela kgotsa go swa.

en: She did not answer
tsn: Ga a ka a mo araba.

en: Benjamin would be 83 today.
tsn: Benjamin nkabe a le dingwaga di le 83 gompieno

en: When Rosensafts mother died in 1997, he realised that the only place Benjamin now lived was inside him.
tsn: Fa mmagwe Rosensafts a tlhokafala ka ngwaga wa 1997, o ne a lemoga gore ke lefelo le le nngwe fela le Benjamin o tlaa tshelang go lona, ke ka fa gare gagwe.

en: I see his face, I try to imagine his voice, I try to imagine his pain, his fear, his anguish and the one thing I know is that if I didnt remember him he would disappear, Rosensaft said.
tsn: Ke bona sefatlhego sa gagwe, ke leka go akanya lentswe la gagwe, ke leka go akanya kutlobotlhoko ya gagwe, le letshogo, mme selo se le sengwe se ke se itseng  ke gore fa ke sa mo gopole o tla nyelela,  go bua Rosensaft.

en: He said he writes about children killed in the Holocaust to give them a measure of immortality.
tsn: O rile a re o kwala ka ga bana ba ba bolailweng ka fa Holocaust go ba neela tekanyetso ya bosasweng.

en: A religiously committed Jew, Rosensafts relationship with God is troubled.
tsn: MoJuta yo o ineetseng mo bodumeding, Botsalano jwa ga Rosensaft le Modimo bo ne bo raraane.

en: One poem, Psalm 13, Post-Auschwitz, starts by telling God:
tsn: Leboko le le lengwe, Pesalome 13, Post-Auschwitz, o simolola ka go bolelela Modimo:

en: You hid Your face, ignored  your world, while flesh-fueled flames pierced the skyt, and ends telling him: It is too late.
tsn: O fitlhile sefatlhego sa gago, wa itlhokomolosa lefatshe fa dikgabo tsa tse tukang mo nameng di tlhasela loapi mme o feleletsa ka go mmolelela gore:.

en: Athletic shoemaker Nike Inc on Monday sued a New York-based company that produced Satan Shoes purported to contain a drop of human blood as part of a collaboration with Old Town Road rapper Lil Nas X.
tsn: Go setse go le thari thata.

en: Nike said in the lawsuit that the company, MSCHF Product Studio Inc, infringed on and diluted its trademark with the black-and-red, devil-themed shoes, which went on sale online on Monday.
tsn: Modiri wa ditlhako wa atleletiki Nike Inc ka Mosupologo o sugile setlamo se se leng kwa New York se se dirang ditlhako tsa Satan se latofatswa ka go nna le lerothodi la madi a motho jaaka jaaka karolo ya tirisanommogo le Repar ya  Old Road Lil Nas X

en: The shoes are customized Nike Air Max 97 sneakers that contain red ink and one drop of human blood in the sole, according to a website describing the 666 pairs of limited edition shoes.
tsn: Nike e rile mo kgetsing ya semolao, setlamo sa MSCHF Product Studio Inc,  se kgoreleditse le go utswa letshwaokgwebo la ditlhako dingwe tsa bona, tse di simolotseng go rekisiwa mo inthaneteng ka Mosupologo.

en: Minister of Sport, Arts and Culture, Nathi Mthethwa says the R300 million which was meant to help support the creative industry as part of the Presidential Employment Stimulus Package programme did not disappear but was overcommitted.
tsn: Ditlhako tseo di kwadilwe Nike Air Max 97, ke ditlhako tse di dirilweng ka enke e khibidu, le lerothodi le le lengwe la madi a batho mo seretheng,  go ya ka webosaete e e neng e tlhalosa dipara di le 660 tsa ditlhako tse di lekanyeditsweng tse.

en: He says the department will conduct a forensic investigation to get to the bottom of the issue.
tsn: Tona ya Metshameko, Botsweretshi le Setso, Nathi Mthethwa a re dimilione tsa diranta di le 300, tse di neng di tshwanetse go thusa go tshegetsa intaseteri ya boitlhamedi jaaka karolo ya lenaneo la go itemogela la thapo, ga e a latlhega mme e ne e dirisitswe mo bamakeng a le mantsi.

en: Mthethwa says the National Arts Councils Chief Executive Officer, Rosemary Mangope, and Chief Financial Officer, Clifton Changfoot, are on suspension over the matter.
tsn: A re Lefapha le tla dira dipatlisiso tsa forensiki go rarabolola ntlha e.

en: This is after they failed to explain to the council about the mismanagement of funds.
tsn: Mthethwa a re, Dikhansele tsa Khuduthamaga ya Bosetšhaba ya khansele ya Botsweretshi, Rosemary Mangope , le Kgosi wa tsa ditšhelete, Clifton Changfoot, ba sekegilwe mabapi le kgang e.

en: Mthethwa says a team has already been appointed to start work on a forensic investigation.
tsn: Se ke morago ga gore ba retelelwe ke go tlhalosetsa khansele ka tsamaiso e e sokameng ya matlole.

en: That number is slightly below estimations that suggested the movie could reach $19.5 million over the weekend, but it’s an impressive haul nonetheless.
tsn: Mugen Train o amogetse madi a a kanang ka dimilione di le 15.9 go tswa kwa mafelong a a farologaneng a le 598 1.

en: The anime action adventure, from Funimation and Aniplex, has been a massive commercial hit in international markets such as Japan, where it currently ranks as the highest-grossing movie ever with $365 million.
tsn: Palo eo, e kwa tlase ga diphopholetso tse di tshitshintseng gore filimi eno e ka fitlhelela dimilione tsa didolara di le 19.5 mo mafelong a beke, le fa go ntse jalo, ke dipalo tse di kgatlhisang.

en: In total, Demon Slayer has surpassed the $400 million mark.
tsn: Filimi e e kgatlhang ya Anime, go tswa ka Funimation & Aniplex, e ntse e le yona e kgolo thata mo mebarakeng ya boditšhabatšhaba e e tshwanang le Japan, kwa e tsewang teng jaaka filimi ya maemo a a kwa godimo ka dimilione di le 365 tsa didolara.

en: Box office analysts have been encouraged by the one-two punch of Mortal Kombat and Demon Slayer, especially since only 50% of cinemas in the country have reopened.
tsn: Ka kakaretso, Demon Slayer e fetile dimilione di le 400 tsa dilolara.

en: Multiplexes that have been able to welcome back patrons have been capping attendance in line with government guidelines.
tsn: Basekaseki ba Box Office ba rotloeditswe ke Mortal Kombat le Demon Slayer, segolobogolo ka gore ke 50% fela ya dibaesekopo tse di butsweng mo nageng ya rona.

en: In Los Angeles, for example, that means 50% capacity or 200 people.
tsn: Multiplexes e kgonneng go amogela gape bareki ba yona, e ntse le lekanya palo ya batho go ya ka dikaelo tsa puso.

en: In New York, theaters will be able to operate at 33% capacity starting on Monday.
tsn: Fa re dira sekao ka Los Angeles, go raya gore 50% kgotsa batho ba le 200.

en: This weekend is another very good step, said David A. Gross, who runs the movie consultancy FranchiseRe.
tsn: Kwa New York, mafelo a dibaesekopo a tlaa kgona go dira ka palo ya batho ya diperesente di le 33 bokgoni go simolola ka Mosupologo.

en: Movie going should start to normalize in early June.
tsn: Mafelo a a beke, ke kgatoe nngwe e e siameng thata, go bua David A. Gross yo e leng motsamaisi wa lefelo la go batla kitso ka difilimi, FranchiseRe.

en: Overseas, Mortal Kombat collected $6.3 million from 37 foreign territories, brings its international tally to $27.6 million.
tsn: Go ya kwa dibaesekopong go tshwanetse go simolola go boela kwa tlwaelong kwa tshimologong ya kgwedi ya Seetebosigo.

en: The film, produced by New Line Cinemas for a modest $55 million, has generated $50 million globally to date.
tsn: Kwa moseja, Mortal Kombat e kgobokantse dimilione di le 6.3 tsa didolara go tswa kwa dinageng di sele, seo se isa palogotlhe ya yona ya boditšhabatšhaba, go dimilione di le 27.6 tsa didolara.

en: Among other wide releases, Godzilla vs. Kong landed in third place with $4.2 million from 2 856 venues.
tsn: Filimi  e e dirilweng ke New line cinemas e, ka dimilione tsa didolara di le 55 fela, e setse e dirile letseno la dimilione di le 50 tsa didolara mo lefatsheng ka bophara, go fitlha gompieno.

en: After four weeks in theaters, the Warner Bros. and Legendary monster mashup has amassed $86.5 million.
tsn: Gareng ga tse dingwe tse di golotsweng, Godzilla vs Kong e iphitlhetse e le mo maemong a boraro ka dimilione di le 4.2 tsa didolara go tswa ka mafelong a le 2 856 mafelo.

en: The film, which is available on HBO Max through the end of April, has surpassed $400 million at the global box office.
tsn: Morago ga dibeke tse nne kwa bobogelong jwa dibaesekopo, The Warner Bros le Legendary Monster di fitlheletse dimilione di le 86.5 tsa didolara.

en: With those ticket sales, it has surpassed Christopher Nolan’s confusing sci-fi spectacle Tenet ($363 million) as the highest-grossing Hollywood blockbuster since the pandemic hit.
tsn: Filimi e e tlaa nnang teng mo HBO Max go fitlhelela  ka mafelo a kgwedi ya Moranang, e setse e fetile dimilione di le 400 tsa didolara kwa Box Office ya lefatshe ka bophara.

en: It’s evident that Godzilla vs. Kong is reigniting movie going everywhere and that audiences are more than ready to return to theaters, where and when its safe, for a big screen experience like this one, said Jeff Goldstein, Warner Bros. president of domestic distribution.
tsn: Ka dithekiso tse tsa ditekethe, e fetile filimi ya ga Christoper Nolan (dimilione  di le $363) jaaka filimi ya kwa Hollywood e e dirileng madi a le mantsi fa e sale ka tshimologo ya leroborobo.

en: The pandemic-delayed Academy Awards ceremony takes place at a Los Angeles rail station on Sunday on what could be a historic night packed with surprises, not just around the winners but the event itself.
tsn: Go a bonala gore Godzilla vs Kong e tsoseletsa go ya kwa dibaesekopong gongwe le gongwe le gore babogedi ba le bantsi ba setse ba le malala a laotswe go boela kwa bobogelong jwa dibaesekopo, kwa go bolokesegileng gona, ka nako e e bolokesegileng, go ya go bogela filimi e e tlhagelelang mo sekerining se segolo jaaka e, go bua Jeff Goldstein, moporesitente wa kwa Warner Bros.

en: We just want the whole thing, right out of the gate, to announce itself as being different, said Steven Soderbergh, one of a trio of producers.
tsn: Moletlo wa kabo ya dikgele wa Akatemi, o o diegisitsweng ke leroborobo, o tlaa diragala kwa seteišheneng sa terena kwa Los Angeles ka Sontaga, kwa go se e ka nnang bosigo jwa motsi wa hisetori, jo bo tletseng dikgagamatso, e seng fela go bafenyi, mme le moletlo ka boone.

en: Few of the winners seem to be locked down after an extended awards season, but Nomadland Chinese-born Chloe Zhaos slow- burn quasi-documentary about the traveling community of American van dwellers is seen as the front runner for taking home best picture.
tsn: Re batla fela yotlhe, tshwanelo ya go bega ka heke e le tse di farologaneng, o rile Steven soderbergh, nngwe ya badiri-ka-ene bantshakuno.

en: The winners are chosen in a secret ballot by the 9 000 members of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.
tsn: Go lebega fa bafenyi ba le mmalwa ba le ka fa tlase ga molao wa kiletso mesepele morago ga setlha sa mekgele se se neng se atolositswe, fela Nomadland, lenaneo la tshedimosetso le le ka ga baagi ba Amerika ba ba tsayang maeto mme ba nna mo di koloing, la ga Chloe Zhaos, yo o bonetsweng kwa China, le bonwa jaaka mofenyi jaaka le ikgapetse sekgele sa setshwantsho se se gaisang.

en: With the slogan Bring your movie love, producers say Sundays show will aim both to encourage people to get back into movie theatres after the long coronavirus closures, and have the look and feel of a film.
tsn: Bafenyi ba tlhophiwa ka tlhopho ya sephiri ke maloko a le 9 000 a Akatemi ya Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

en: It’s trying to be like a movie, except that the Oscars is a TV show about the movies.
tsn: Ka moono o o reng “tlisa lorato la gago la filimi” bantshakuno ba re  Sontaga e tlaa nna letsatsi le ka lona ba tlaa rotloetsang batho go boela kwa bobogelong jwa difilimi morago ga go tswalelwa sebaka ka ntlha ya Coronavirus, le gore ba iponele le go ikutlwela filimi.

en: So I’m really curious about that, said Hammond.
tsn: E leka go tshwana le filimi, ntle fela le gore di Oscar, ke lenaneo la thelebišhene, le le ka ga difilimi.

en: Up-and-coming musicians in Durban have come together to hold open-air busking performances in public spaces as part of the Independent Artists Busking Project.
tsn: Ka jalo, ke tota ke batla go itse ka ga seo, go bua Hammond.

en: The initiative provides a platform for musicians who have been struggling to earn a living during the COVID-19 pandemic.
tsn: Diopedi tse dišwa tsa kwa Durban di kopane go tla go tshwara moletlo wa go diragatsa mo pepeneng jaaka karolo ya porojeke ya bataki ba ba ikemetseng, ba ba diragatsang mo mebileng.

en: Artist Sandy B has turned to online platforms to host virtual gigs, saying it’s been an opportunity to draw in global audiences.
tsn: Letsholo leno le tlamela ka tsela ya go itshedisa go diopedi tse di ntseng di thatafalelwa ke go itshedisa ka nako ya leroborobo la covid-19.

en: But he’s lamented on how COVID-19 relief funding is managed for struggling artists.
tsn: Motsweretshi Sandy B, o dirisa mafaratlhatlha go tshwara meletlo ya gagwe ya setshwantshokgopolo, a re se, se mo file tšhono ya go gogela babogedi lefatshe ka bophara.

en: As I’m talking to you now, I’m even feeling emotional.
tsn: Fela o hutsafatswa ke ka mokgwa o thuso ya matlole ya COVID-19, ya go thusa batswerentshi ba ba nang le dikgwetlho, e tsamaisiwang ka yona

en: It’s not nice because you stand in front of a big audience somewhere abroad and say all these nice things and the way we are treated as South African artists is not nice.
tsn: Jaaka ke bua le wena jaana, ke tlelwa ke bohutsana.

en: We have built our own profile sometimes, most of us without even pressurizing the government.
tsn: Ga go monate ka gore o ema fa pele ga babogedi ba le bantsi golo gongwe kwa moseja, o bue dilo tsotlhe tse di monate, mme tsela e re tshwarwang ka yona re le batswerentshi ba Aforikaborwa, ga e monate.

en: Even when these funds are being distributed you get shocked that people who are beneficiaries are new in the industry, one or 2 years old.
tsn: Re ikagetse diporofaele tsa rona, ka dinako tse dingwe, kwa ntle ga go tsenya puso ka fa tlase ga kgatelelo.

en: Or some new companies and so on.
tsn: Le fa go phasaladiwa matlole a, o makadiwa ke gore batho ba ba fiwang matlole a, ke ba santseng la ba le bašwa mo intasetering, gongwe ba na le ngwaga e le nngwe kgotsa di le 2.

en: The Denis Hurley Centres director, Raymond Perrier, says music plays a powerful role in bringing together people from all walks of life.
tsn: Kgotsa ditlamo tse dišwa, jalo le jalo.

en: I think its really important in South Africa today to bring together all citizens of this country so they can share a space and share an experience.
tsn: Mokaedi waDenis Hurley, Raymond Perrier, a re mmino o na seabe se se maatla thata mo go kopanyeng batho go tswa mo mefameng yotlhe ya botshelo.

en: We’re getting closer to Freedom Day and we remember that wonderful moment in 1994 all kinds of South Africans came together to vote and in the same way music brings people together.
tsn: Ke akanya gore go botlhokwa thata mo Aforikaborwa gompieno go kopanya baagi botlhe ba naga, gore ba kgone go kopanela mo lefelong le le lengwe le go abelana maitemogelo a bona.

en: But we also have to remember that during this terrible time of COVID musicians and artists are some of the people who haven’t been able to make a living.
tsn: Letsatsi la Kgololosego le atumetse, mme re gakologelwa nako e le e e monate ka 1994. Mefuta yotlhe ya MaAforikaborwa e kopane go ya go tlhopha, mme ka tsela e e tshwanang le eo, mmino o kopanya batho.

en: so giving them a chance to make a living to be able to perform their art and make some money is also really important.
tsn: Mme gape re tshwanetse go gakologelwa gore ka nako e e bosula e ya COVID, diopedi le batswerentshi ke bangwe ba batho ba ntseng ba sa kgone go itshedisa.

en: artists cry foul after struggling to access COVID-19 relief fund, Dr Sipho Sithole.
tsn: Ka jalo, go ba naya tšhono ya go itshedisa, ya gore ba kgone go diragatsa botaki jwa bona le gona go botlhokwa thata.

en: In commemoration of the Soweto Uprising, renowned theatre creator Jerry Pooe and music director Mondli Ngcobo, are putting together 1976 The Musical.
tsn: Batswerentshi ba ntshitse dilelo tsa bona morago ga gore ba nne le kgwetlho ya go fitlhelela letlole la thuso la COVID-19, Ngaka Sipho Sithole.

en: This will form part of the 45th anniversary of the June 16th commemorations.
tsn: Ka segopotso sa dikhuduego tsa kwa Soweto, Jerry Pooe yo e leng montshakuno wa tsa dibaesekopo le mokaedi wa mmino Mondli Ngcobo, ba lenaneo la “1976 The Musical”.

en: Lead actors include Dawn King, Baby Cele, Khaya Dladla, and Wiseman Mncube.
tsn: Seno e tla nna karolo ya ya go keteka ngwaga wa bo 45, wa segopotso sa di 16 tsa Seetebosigo.

en: The theatre production company has made a call for auditions.
tsn: Badiragatsi ba ba kwa pele ba akaretsa Dawn King, Baby Cele, Khaya Dladla le Wiseman Mncube.

en: They will take place on Monday at the Durban Music School.
tsn: Setlamo sa ntshokuno ya bobogelo se dirile taletso ya ditekokutlwelelo.

en: Jerry Pooe who is the Director for 1976 The Musical says, It will be different because we are going to be mordenizing it.
tsn: Tsona di tlaa tshwarwa ka Mosupologo kwa sekolong  sa Mmino sa kwa Durban.

en: It’s going to be happening at this period of time but of course with the reflections of 1976 and it’s going to be also having a lot of videos and images, lots of images.
tsn: Jerry Pooe, yo e leng Mokaedi wa “1976 The Musical”, a re, e tlile go farogalogana le tse dingwe ka ntlha ya gore re tlile go dira dilo ka tsela la sešweng.

en: So, it’s really going to be a big production with the support of multimedia in it.
tsn: Yona e tlaa diragala mo nakong e, mme re lebile kwa morago ditaragalo tsa 1976. E tlile go nna le dibidio le ditshwantsho tse di ntsi. Ditshwantso tse di ntsintsi fela.

en: Jerry Pooe discusses the theatre production.
tsn: Ka jalo yona e tlile go nna ntshokuno e kgolo, ka tshegetso ya bobegakgang mo go yona.

en: It’s a year of multiple firsts at this year’s Oscars, the 93rd Academy Awards ceremony for the highest achievement in film.
tsn: Jerry Pooe o bua ka ntshokuno ya bobogelo.

en: Following is a list of major milestones this year.
tsn: Ke ngwaga wa go bona dilo le dintsi lwantlha kwa di Oscars tsa ngwaga o, moletlo wa bo 93 wa dikgele tsa Akatemi wa phitlhelelo e e kwa godimo mo filiming.

en: The winners will be announced at a ceremony in Los Angeles on Sunday.
tsn: Se se latelang ke lenaane la ba ba nnileng le phitlhelelo e kgolo mo ngwageng ono.

en: First Asian woman and first woman of color to be nominated for best director (Nomadland).
tsn: Bafenyi ba tlaa begwa kwa moletlong wa kwa Los Angeles ka Sontaga.

en: First woman to be nominated best director for her feature film debut (Promising Young Woman).
tsn: Mosadi wa ntlha wa MoAsia le mosadi wa ntlha wa mmala go tlhophiwa jaaka Mokaedi yo o gaisang (Nomadland ).

en: This is the first time two women have been nominated for directing in the same year.
tsn: Mosadi wa ntlha go tlhophiwa jaaka mokaedi wa wa filimi ya gagwe ya ntlha (Promising Young Woman)

en: Women received a record 76 nominations across all categories.
tsn: Se ke lokgetlho lwa ntlha basadi ba babedi ba tlhophiwa mo karolong ya go kaela mo ngwageng o le mongwe.

en: First Muslim to be nominated best actor (Sound of Metal).
tsn: Basadi ba bone rekoto  ya ditlhopho di le 76 go ralala dikarolo tsotlhe.

en: Mahershala Ali was the first Muslim actor to win for his supporting roles in Moonlight (2016) and Green Book (2018).
tsn: Momoseleme wa ntlha go tlhopiwa mo karolong ya modiragatsi yo o gaisang (Sound of Metal)

en: First Oscar nomination for Boseman, who died of cancer in August 2020, before the release of his final film (Ma Raineys Black Bottom).
tsn: Mahershala Ali e ne e le modiragatsi wa ntlha go fenya mo dikarolong tsa gagwe ya go ema nokeng mo Moonlight (2016) le Green Book (2018).

en: Judas and the Black Messiah: First best picture nominee made by an all-Black production team.
tsn: E ne e le tlhopho ya ntlha ya ga Boseman ya di Oscar, yo o tlhokafetseng ka ntlha ya kankere ka Phatwe 2020, pele ga kgololo ya filimi ya gagwe ya bofelo (Black Bottom ya ga Ma Rainey).

en: First South Korean actor or actress to land an Oscar nomination (Minari).
tsn: Judas and the Black Messiah: Tlhopho ya ntlha ya Setswhantsho se se gaisitseng se se dirilweng ke setlhopha ba bantshakono ba batho bantsho

en: First Asian American to receive a best actor nomination (Minari).
tsn: Modiragatsi wa ntlha wa moKorea go fitlhela tlhopho ya di Oscar (Minari).

en: Her fourth acting nomination makes Davis the most nominated Black actress in Oscar history.
tsn: Modiragatsi wa ntlha wa MoAsia wa kwa Amerika go bona tlhopho ya modiragatsi yo o gaisang (Minari).

en: She has won once.
tsn: Tlhopho ya gagwe ya bone, e baya Davis mo maemong a go nna modiragatsi wa mosadi yo o tlhophilweng go ba feta botlhe mo hisetoring ya di Oscar.

en: At age 83, Hopkins is the oldest best actor nominee ever.
tsn: O kile a fenya gangwe.

en: First nomination for the North African country (The Man Who Sold His Skin).
tsn: Ka dingwaga di le 83, Hopkins ke modiragatsi yo o tsofetseng go ba feta yo o tlhophilweng go nna modiragatsi yo o gaisang.

en: First nomination for Romania (Collective), which is competing in both the international film field and best documentary categories.
tsn: Tlhopho ya ntlha ya naga ya Bokone jwa Aforika (The Man Who Sold His Skin).

en: First Bulgarian actress to be Oscar nominated (Borat Subsequent Moviefilm).
tsn: Tlhopho ya ntlha ya Romania (e e kopanetsweng), e e gaisanang mo karolong ya filimi ya  boditšhabatšhaba le mo karolong ya lenaneo la tshedimosetso le le gaisang.

en: A record nine of the 20 acting nominees are people of color: Andra Day, Chadwick Boseman, Leslie Odom Jr., LaKeith Stanfield, Riz Ahmed, Daniel Kaluuya, Viola Davis, Steven Yeun, Youn Yuh-jung.
tsn: Modiragatsi wa ntlha wa kwa Bulgaria go tlhophelwa Oscar (Borat Subsequent Moviefilm ).

en: Academy Awards Ceremony Will be held on April 25 at Union Station in downtown Los Angeles for the first time, as well as at the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood.
tsn: Rekoto: Ba le robonngwe ba badiragatsi ba le 20 ba ba tlhophilweng ke batho ba mmala: Andra Day, Chadwick Boseman, Leslie Odom Jr., LaKeith Stanfield, Riz Ahmed, Daniel Kaluuya, Viola Davis, Steven Yeun, Youn Yuh-jung

en: American rapper and actor Earl Simmons, known by his stage name DMX or Dark Man X, will be mourned by fans around the world in a livestreamed event from Brooklyns Barclays Centre on Saturday.
tsn: Moletlo wa dikgele tsa akatemi e tla tshwarwa ka la 25 Motsheganong kwa seteišeneng sa Union kwa toropong ya Los Angeles lwa ntlha, gammogo le kwa bobogelong jwa Dolby kwa Hollywood.

en: Simmons, 50, died on April 9 after suffering a heart attack a week earlier, which many media outlets initially attributed to a drug overdose.
tsn: Modiragatsi wa mmino wa Rap, Earl Simmons, yo o neng a itsege ka la DMX kgotsa Dark Man X, o tlaa hutsafalewa ke baetleetsi ba gagwe lefatshe ka bophara mo moletlong yo o tlaa tshwarelwang kwa Barclays Centre kwa Brooklyn ka Lamatlhatso.

en: The memorial at the Barclays Centre will be closed to the public but will be streamed live on DMXs YouTube account at 4 p.m. ET (2000 GMT).
tsn: Simmons wa dingwaga di le 50, o tlhokafetse ka la 9 Moranang morago ga go tlhaselwa ke bolwetse jwa pelo beke pele ga foo. Ba le bantsi ba metswedi ya dikgang ba setse ba e golagantse le tiriso e e botlhwaswa ya diritibatsi

en: A second event will be broadcast live on BET Sunday at 2:30 p.m. ET (1830 GMT) from an undisclosed church in the New York City area.
tsn: Setšhaba ga se kitla go letlelelwa go tsena kwa segopotsong se se tlaa tshwarelwang kwa Barclays Center mme ba tlaa letlelelwa go bogela mo mafaratlhatlheng mo akhaontong ya DMX ya YouTube ka ura ya 4 motshegare ET (2000 GMT).

en: His chart-topping songs included Party Up (Up in Here) and X Gon Give It to Ya.
tsn: Moletlo wa bobedi o tlaa phasalatswa ka tlhamalalo mo BET ka Sontanga ka 2:30 motshegare ET (1830 GMT) go tswa kwa kerekeng e leina la yona le sa rebolwang kwa lefelong la New York City.

en: The Yonkers, New York natives’ career had been marked by legal troubles and prison time, and a well-publicised struggle with drug addiction.
tsn: Dipina tsa gagwe tse di neng di tumile thata di akaretsa Party Up (Up in Here) and X Gon Give It to Ya.

en: The musician’s family, in a statement to People magazine, said he died at New York’s White Plains Hospital with family by his side.
tsn: Tiro ya monna yo o neng a tswa kwa The Yonkers kwa New York yo, e ne e dikaganyeditswe ke mathata a semolao, nako e a neng a e dula kwa kgolegelong le bokgoba jwa ba diritibatsi jo bo neng bo itsege thata.

en: Fans had gathered for days before his death, holding prayer vigils outside the suburban New York hospital, where he had been reported on life support and in a coma.
tsn: Ba lelapa la seopedi se, mo tlhagisong ya makasine wa People’s magazine, le kaile fa a tlhokafaletse kwa bookelong jwa White’s Plain kwa New York, a na le ba lelapa mo letlhakore la gagwe.

en: His rap career had an impressive start, with his debut album in 1998 Its Dark and Hell is Hot, listed as number one on the Billboard 200 chart in the United States.
tsn: Baetleetsi ba gagwe ba ne bakgobokana matsatsi pele ga loso lwa gagwe, go tshwara thapelo kwa ntle ga bookelo jwa kwa New York, kwa go neng go begilwe fa mo botshelo jwa bo ne bo tshegeditswe ke metšhine gona.

en: It sold more than 5 million copies.
tsn: Tiro ya gagwe ya mmino wa RAP e simolotse e kgatlhisa fa album wa gagwe ya ntlha ka 1998 e e neng e bidiwa “Its Dark and Hell is Hot” e ne e tlhageletse mo maemong a ntlha mo chateng ya dipina di le 200 kwa United States.

en: Along with being mourned by fans around the world, his death spurred an outpouring of condolences from stars such as Chance the Rapper who said on social media, Rest in Heaven DMX.
tsn: E rekisitse dikhopi tse di fetang dimilione di le 5 ka palo.

en: Healthcare workers took time out from their hectic and heavy schedules to de-stress in Durban today.
tsn: Mmogo le go hutsafalelwa ke baetleetsi ba gagwe lefatshe ka bophara, loso lwa gagwe lo bakile thologelo ya melaetsa e le mentsi ya matshediso go tswa kwa dinaleding tse di tshwanang le seopedi sa mmino wa Rap, Chance, yo o rileng mo mmedieng wa botsalano “Robala kwa legodimong DMX”

en: They participated in an inter-hospital tournament.
tsn: Badiri ba tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo ba tsere nako go tswa mo tirong ya bona e e boima go ya go ikhutsisa ditshika tsa bona tsa tlhaloganyo kwa Durban gompieno.

en: Under the banner Caring for Caregivers, nurses and doctors from 10 public and private health facilities played sports such as soccer and netball.
tsn: Ba ne ba tsaya karolo mo kgaisanong ya thomamente ya kwa bookelong.

en: More than 700 healthcare workers have succumbed to COVID-19 related complications since April last year.
tsn: Ka fa tlase ga ga moono o o reng “Go tlhokomela batlhokomedi”, baoki le dingaka go tswa kwa maokelong a le 10 a setšhaba le a poraefete ba ne ba tshameka metshameko e e tshwanang le motshameko wa kgwele ya dinao le bolotloa.

en: We are hoping to bring them together and be the one team we have seen them during COVID-19 they are working together, saving our lives.
tsn: Badiri ba tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo ba ba fetang 700 ka palo, ba tlhokafetse ka ntlha ya malwetse a a marara a a amanang le COVID-19 go tloga ka Moranang mo ngwageng o o fetileng.

en: Some have lost their lives during this time.
tsn: Re solofela go ba kopanya go nna setlhopha se le sengwe. Re ba bone ka nako ya COVID-19 gore ba ne ba dira mmogo, go boloka matshelo a rona.

en: We want to express how thankful we are and we are appreciative about the work they have done, says Samukelisiwe Mnguni, one of the Medi-Splash Sport Tournament organisers.
tsn: Bangwe ba latlhegetswe ke matshelo a bona ka nako e.

en: Government has now begun registering the elderly and those with comorbidities for the COVID-19 vaccine.
tsn: Re batla go bontsha ditebogo tsa rona go bona ka ditiro tse ba di dirileng, go bua  Samukelisiwe Mnguni, mongwe wa barulaganyi ba thonamente ya metshameko ya Medi-Splash.

en: Healthcare workers have been prioritised, but with the third wave looming, doctors say it’s up to the public to delay it or prevent the spread by adhering to all COVID-19 protocols.
tsn: Puso jaanong e simolotse go kwadisa bagodi le ba ba nang le malwetse a mangwe gore ba bone mokento Wa COVID-19.

en: We don’t know if we will get a third wave or not. with God’s grace we hope it doesn’t come.
tsn: Badiri ba tlhokomelo ba tla pele mme ka lekhubu la boraro le le tlang, dingaka di a re, go mo diatleng tsa setšhaba go le diegisa kgotsa go thibela kanamo ka go latela melao yotlhe ya COVID-19.

en: But it all depends on you and I, what we do to save the population from the third wave, says Dr Stephen Simango.
tsn: Ga re itse gore a re tla bona lekhubu la boraro kgotsa nnyaa. Ka kutlwelobotlhoko ya Modimo, re solofela gore ga le kitla le nna teng.

en: Healthcare practitioners shared their experiences of working during a pandemic.
tsn: Tsotlhe di ikaegile mo go nna le wena, gore re dira eng go sireletsa setšhaba kgatlhanong le lekhubu la boraro, go bua Ngaka Stephen Simango.

en: It was a tricky situation for us because it’s something we have never experienced before but with the grace of God, we managed to take good care of them (patients).
tsn: Badiri ba tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo ba abelane ka maitemogelo a bona a go dira ka nako ya leroborobo.

en: It wasn’t about us but taking good care of our patients we are there with them, holding their hands because we were actually like a family to them and proving them with all their needs, says Thozama Lwana, a nurse.
tsn: E ne e le maemo a a seng bonolo mo go rona ka gonne ke selo se re se nang maitemogelo a sona, mme ka kutlwelobotlhoko ya Modimo, re kgonne go ba fa tlhokomelo e ntle (balwetse).

en: Pharmacist Sphamandla Made adds: It’s been a very tough year especially with COVID-19 coming along so this is the opportunity to meet up with old friends and family because we treat them like family.
tsn: Ga e se fela ka ga tlhokomelo e ntle e re e fang balwetse ba rona, re ntse re na le bona, re ba tshwere ka diatla gonne re tshwana le ba lelapa mo go bona mme re ba tlamela ka ditlhokego tsa bona, go bua Thozama Lwana, mooki.

en: So it’s great to be outside to be playing and free again.
tsn: Ramelemo, Sphamandla o a tlaleletsa: E nnile ngwaga o o boima thata segologolo ka ntlha ya COVID-19 ka jalo se ke tšhono ya gore re kopane le ditsala tsa kgale ba losika gonne re ba tshwara fela jaaka ba losika.

en: Participants were awarded prizes for their service to the community.
tsn: Ka jalo go a itumedisa go nna kwa ntle, go tshameka le go lokologa gape.

en: Former New York Mayor Rudy Giuliani’s unwitting appearance in Borat Subsequent Moviefilm was named one of the years worst performances by voters for the annual Razzie prizes on Saturday.
tsn: Batsayakarolo ba ne ba newa dikabelo tsa ditiro tsa bona tse ba di direlang baagi.

en: The Razzies, or Golden Raspberry Awards, were created in 1980 and serve as an antidote to Hollywood’s glitzy Oscar’s ceremony, which take place on Sunday.
tsn: Tiragatso ya mmeyara wa maloba wa kwa New York mo filiming ya Borat, e ne a kaiwa e le nngwe ya ditiragatso tse di sa kgatlhiseng ke batlhophi ba moputso wa ngwaga le ngwaga wa Razzie ka Lamatlhatso.

en: Giuliani was named the worst supporting actor for his brief appearance in Sacha Baron Cohens Borat mockumentary sequel.
tsn: Di Razzie, kgotsa meputso ya Golden Raspberry, e tlhamilwe ka ngwaga wa 1980 mme di dira jaaka pheko kwa moletlong wa manobonobo wa di Oscar kwa Hollywood, o o tlaa diragalang ka Sontaga.

en: The former mayor was unknowingly filmed in a hotel room with an actress pretending to be a reporter.
tsn: Giuliani o ne a kaiwa e le modiragatsi yo o tshegetsang yo o sa kgatlhiseng mo tlhagelelong ya gagwe ya nakwana mo lenaneong la tshedimosetso la Borat la ga Sacha Baron Cohen.

en: Giuliani has said nothing inappropriate happened.
tsn: Meyara wa maloba o ne a gatisiwa kwa ntle ga kitso ya gagwe kwa phaposing ya kwa hoteleng le modiragatsi yo o neng a itirile mmegadikgang.

en: Absolute Proof, a movie by My Pillow Chief Executive Mike Lindell, was voted the years worst picture.
tsn: Giuliani o rile ga go na sepe se se sa siamang se se diragetseng.

en: The film featured baseless claims of fraud in the 2020 US presidential election.
tsn: Bopaki jo bo tletseng, filimi ya ga Mike Lindell e e bidiwang “My pillow’ e tlhophilwe go nna setshwantsho sa ngwaga se se maswe go di feta tshotlhe.

en: Lindell, a vocal supporter of former US President Donald Trump, also was named worst actor.
tsn: Filimi e, e tlhagisitse ditletlebo tsa tsietso kwa ditlhophong tsa moporeditente ka ngwaga wa 2020.

en: Music, a movie directed by musician Sia about a young girl with autism, won the most Razzies overall, with three including worst actress for Kate Hudson.
tsn: Lindell, motshegetsi wa moporesidente wa maloba Donald trump, le ena o ne kaiwa e le modiragatsi yo o se nang bokgoni.

en: Razzie winners were chosen by 1 097 members from more than two dozen countries.
tsn: Mmino, filimi e e tsamaisiwang ke Sia ka ga mosetsana yo monnye yo o nang le bolwetse jwa autism, e fentse di Razzie di le dintsi ka kakaretso, tse tharo di akaretsa ya modiragatsi yo o se nang bokgoni ya ga Kate Hudson.

en: Members sign up online and pay a $40 membership fee.
tsn: Bafenyi ba di Razzie ba ne ba tlhopilwe ke ditokololo di le 1 097 go tswa kwa dinageng tse di fetang tse pedi.

en: The City of Tshwane says it wants to take control of the neglected Women’s Living Heritage Monument at Lillian Ngoyi Square in Pretoria.
tsn: Ditokololo di ikwadisa mo inthaneteng mme di duela madi a botokololo a a kanang ka dilolara di le 40.

en: The monument remains closed, four years after its launch.
tsn: Toropo ya Tshwane ya re e batla go tsaya taolo ya sefikantswe sa Women’s Living Heritage kwa Lillian Ngoyi square kwa Pretoria.

en: The delays were due to disputes between appointed service providers and sub-contractors.
tsn: Sefikantswe se, se santse se tswetswe, dingwaga di le nne morago ga go tlhomiwa ga sona.

en: The multi-million rand facility was also declared a fire hazard.
tsn: Ditiego tse, di ne di bakwa ke dikgotlhang magareng ga batlamedi ba ditirelo ba ba thapilweng.

en: The City believes it can take better care of the monument and wants to take over the facility from the Gauteng Department of Sport, Arts, Culture, and Recreation.
tsn: Kago e ya dimilione di le dintsi tsa di ranta e ne kailwe fa e le kotsi e bile e ka tsosa molelo.

en: The monument aims to celebrate and preserve the history of women who played a role in the liberation struggle of South Africa.
tsn: Toropo e dumela gore e na le bokgoni jwa go tlhokomela sefikantswe se sentle mme ba batla go se amoga Lefapha la Metshameko, Botsweretshi, Setso, le boitapoloso la kwa Gauteng.

en: Unveiled in 2016 by former President Jacob Zuma, the heritage site features statues of four struggle stalwarts, Lillian Ngoyi, Helen Joseph, Sophie de Bruyn, and Rahima Moosa, who led the historic 1956 Women’s March to the Union Buildings.
tsn: Sefikantswe se, se tlhometswe go keteka le go boloka hisetori ya basadi ba ba nnileng le seabe mo go kgaratlheleng tokologo ya Aforikaborwa.

en: It was also set to have a leadership and development training centre and to boost tourism activity in the capital.
tsn: Se sirolotswe ka 2016 ke moporesidente wa maloba Jacob Zuma. Lefelo le la ngwaoboswa le na le ditshwantsho tse di tlhomilweng di le nne, tsa baikanyegi ba kgaratlho: Lillian Ngoyi , Helen Joseph, Sophie de Bruyn le Rahima Moosa , yo o neng a eteletse pele  mogwanto wa basadi ka ngwaga wa 1956 go ya kwa Union Buildings.

en: This week, Tshwane Mayor Randall Williams conducted an oversight visit at the facility and indicated that the city wanted to take over the facility.
tsn: Gape le ne le le tshwanetse go nna le senthara ya ikatiso ya tlhabololo ya boeteledipele le go godisa bojanala mo khepetleleng.

en: We did indicate to the provincial government as the City of Tshwane that we are interested in taking over the project
tsn: Mo bekeng e, Ratoropo wa Tshwane Randall Williams o ile a etela kwa kagong eo mme a kaya fa ba batla go e tsaya.

en: but then if we are going to take over it becomes our project as the city.
tsn: Re le toropo ya Tshwane, re boleletse puso ya porofense gore re na le kgatlhego ya go tsaya porojeke e.

en: Then we’ll be able to fix and make sure it’s in good condition because one of the key pillars here in Tshwane which were mentioned by the mayor during his state of the capital address is that we want to attract tourism and we do see this monument as one of the key sites that would drive that tourism drive.
tsn: Mme fa e le gore re a e tsaya, e tlaa nna porojeke ya rona jaaka toropo.

en: We want to get onto it, so the city is interested in running this project, says spokesperson, Sipho Stuurman.
tsn: Ka jalo, re tlaa kgona go e baakanya le go netefatsa gore e mo maemong a a siameng ka gonne nngwe ya dipilara tsa mo Tshwane tse di kailweng ke meyara mo puong ya gagwe ya madi ke gore, re batla go ngoka bojanala mme re bona sefikantswe se jaaka nngwe ya dikarolo tse di botlhokwa tse di tlaa rotloetsang bojanala.

en: Squabbles between appointed contractors are cited as the main reason for the delay.
tsn: Re batla go simolola ka yona. Toropo e na le kgatlhego mo go tsamaiseng porojeke eno, go bua  mmueledi, Sipho Stuurman.

en: The condition of the building has since worsened due to vandalism.
tsn: Dikgotlhang magareng ga borakonteraka ba ba tlhophilweng, di kaiwa jaaka lebaka la konokono le ke bakang tiego.

en: It was also declared a fire hazard by the city’s fire department, which declined to grant a certificate of occupancy.
tsn: Maemo a kago e a ile kwa tlase thata ka ntlha ya tshenyo.

en: The situation currently with the monument is that it is not in a good state since the monument was launched in 2016, the building does not have an occupancy certificate but also the building does not have full-time staff who make sure its in good condition or offer security.
tsn: Lefapha la tsa molelo la toropo, le begile fa kago e, e na le kotsi ya molelo mme le ganne go neelana ka setifikeiti sa bonno.

en: The building is not compliant with a number of building regulations, there’s also electrical cabling of the building that has been vandalized, several things in the building have been vandalized.
tsn: Maemo a ga jaana ka Sefikantswe ke gore, ga se mo maemong a a siameng fa e sale se sirololwa ka ngwaga wa 2016. Kago e, ga e na le setifikeiti sa bonno mme gape ga e na badiri ba ba ka netefatsang gore e mo maemong a a siameng kgotsa e babalesegile.

en: So, it’s not in a good state to be occupied, explains Stuurman.
tsn: Kago e ga e latele melawana e le mmalwa ya go aga. Gape go na le dithapo tsa motlakase tse di sentsweng. Dilo di le mmalwa mo kagong e o, di sentswe.

en: It costs the provincial department of Sports, Arts Culture and Recreation at least R2 million annually for the maintenance and upkeep of the unused facility.
tsn: Ka jalo, ga e mo maemong a a siameng go ka tsenwa go yona, go tlhalosa Stuurman.

en: The Democratic Alliance in the Gauteng Legislature has called on MEC, Mbali Hlophe, to prioritise the project in honour of the historical legacy of women.
tsn: Lefapha la porofense la Metshameko, Botsweretshi le Setso le boitapoloso, le duela madi a a kanang ka dimilione di le 2 ngwaga le ngwaga go tlhokomela kago e e sa dirisweng e.

en: We feel that this is like money being thrown down a bottomless pit.
tsn: Lekoko la Democtratic Alliance mo Gauteng le kopile MEC, Mbali Hlophe go baya porojeke e kwa pele ka tsela ya go tlotla Boswa le Hisitori ya basadi.

en: It’s something they need to prioritise; some of the things they are prioritising are not benefitting the arts and heritage within the province.
tsn: Re ikutlwa jaaka e kete se, se tshwana fela le go latlhela madi mo mosimeng yo o boteng.

en: Maybe the department must start prioritising these things and ensure that the Gauteng community gets the value of these institutions, says Democratic Alliance’s Kingsol Chabalala.
tsn: Yona ke sengwe se se tlhokang go bewa kwa pele; dingwe tsa dilo tse di re baya kwa pele ga di thuse botaki le boswa jwa mo  porofenseng e ka sepe.

en: The department denies the facility has been neglected.
tsn: Gongwe Lefapha le tshwanetse go simolola go baya dilo tseno kwa pele, go netefatsa gore baagi Gauteng ba bona boleng jwa ditheo tse, go bua Kingsol Chabalala, wa lekoko la Democratic Alliance.

en: In a statement, it says it is focusing on outstanding issues to get the occupancy certificate .
tsn: Lefapha le ganela gore kago e, e ntse e ikgatholositswe.

en: Spokesperson, Nomazwe Ntlokwana, says the facility should be fully operational in August.
tsn: Mo tlhagisong,  le rile le tlhomile mogopolo mo mererong e e saleng kwa morago go bona setifikeiti sa bonno.

en: A mobile breast cancer screening unit at George in the Southern Cape is providing women with the opportunity to go for a mammogram and breast ultrasound in a safe and convenient, out-of-hospital environment.
tsn: Mmueledi, Nomazwe Ntlokwana, a re kago e, e  tshwanetse gore e be e dira ka botlalo ka kgwedi ya Phatwe.

en: The unit, nicknamed Dolly, is the only one of its kind in South Africa.
tsn: Yuniti ya kankere ya mabele e e tsamaisiwang kwa George, kwa Borwa jwa Kapa, e tlamela basadi ka tšhono ya go dira ekeserei ya mabele  mo lefelong le le tshwanetseng, mo tikologong e e kwa ntle ga bookelo.

en: It is operated by an all-female staff.
tsn: Yuniti e e filweng leina la metshwamekwane la Dolly, ke e le nngwe fela ya mofuta o mo Aforikaborwa.

en: One in every 25 women is likely to be diagnosed with breast cancer in her lifetime.
tsn: E tsamaisiwa ke badiri ba basadi fela.

en: Radiologist Dr. Nikoli van Zyl says all women should have regular self-examinations and go for screening if they find any abnormalities.
tsn: Mosadi a le mongwe mo go ba le 25, o na kgonagalo ya go ka tshwarwa ke bolwetse jwa kankere ya mabele mo botshelong jwa gagwe.

en: She says it is very important that women over the age of 40 go for yearly screenings.
tsn: Ngaka e e dirisang kalafi ya marang, Ngaka. Nikoli van Zyl a re basadi botlhe ba tshwanetse go nna ka gale ba itekola mme fa ba lemoga sengwe se se  sa tlwaelegang, ba ye go bona ngaka.

en: Dr. Van Zyl says they are encouraging early detection through their Screen-Her- Save Her campaign.
tsn: A re go botlhokwa thata gore basadi ba ba fetileng dingwaga di le 40, ba ye go tlholwa ngwaga le ngwaga.

en: You diagnose cancer, preferably even before the patient is aware of a lump.
tsn: Ngaka. van Zyl a re ba rotloetsa temogo ya bonako ka go dirisa letsholo la bona la “Mo tlhole – mmoloke”

en: The earlier you detect it, the more treatment options you have and the better the outcome, the end for the patient.
tsn: O lemoga kankere, pele ga molwetse a nne le kitso ya gore o na le yona.

en: That’s why we want to push the mammography and ultrasound awareness in the community.
tsn: Fa o e lemoga go sale gale, O ka kgona go tla ka dikakanyo di le ntsi tsa go e alafa mme fa dipoelo di le botoka, molwetse o tlaa alafega.

en: It’s not for women who feel a lump, not only for women who have a family history of breast cancer, it’s for every single woman above the age of 40.
tsn: Ke ka moo re batlang go rotloetsa kitso ya ekeserei mo baaging.

en: State-of-the-art equipment and highly specialised personnel offer patients fast and efficient radiology services.
tsn: Yona ga e se ya basadi ba nang le madi a a kgolokileng fela, ga e se ya basadi ba ba nang le hisetori ya lelapa ya kankere ya mabele fela, ke ya mosadi mongwe le mongwe yo o kwa godimo ga dingwaga di le 40.

en: One of the patients, Annelize Richards, says she will definitely recommend the service provided.
tsn: Maemo a didiriswa tse di kgethegileng le badiri ba ba nang le kitso e e nonofileng di tlamela balwetse ka ditirelo tsa ekeserei tse di bonako e bile di thusa.

en: My experience has been great.
tsn: Mongwe wa balwetse, Annelize Richards, a re o tla atlenegisa tirelo e e neelwang.

en: The ladies are so professional and so friendly.
tsn: Maitemogelo a me e nnile a mantle thata.

en: With us ladies, this type of examination is so uncomfortable, but they make you feel at ease.
tsn: Bomme ba ba tsamaisa tiro ya bona ka tsela ya seporofešenale ebile ba na le botsalano jo bontle.

en: So, the moment they start with you their friendly
tsn: Mofuta o wa tlhatlhobo ga o monate mo go rona bomme, fela ba dire gore o ikutlwe o sena letswalo.

en: you feel at ease and forget you had any discomfort.
tsn: Ka jalo, fa ba simolola ka wena, ba bontsha botsalano jo bontle.

en: But the services don’t stop at the mobile unit.
tsn: O ikutlwa o se na letswalo mme o lebale gore o ne o na le matshwenyego.

en: The staff and ambassadors go the extra mile to support and guide patients who have tested positive.
tsn: Mme ditirelo tsa bona ga di felele kwa yuniting e e tsamaisiwang.

en: Dr. Van Zyl says the Screen-Her-Save-Her Facebook group is also available to patients and their family members.
tsn: Badiri le baemedi ba dira go tlala seatla go tshegetsa le go kaela balwetse ba diteko tsa bona di bontshang ba na le bolwetse.

en: We have patients who have had cancer, who have recently gone through this whole process, who are available for newly-diagnosed patients to just speak to them and share their experience, because you can’t tell someone what its like unless you’ve been through it.
tsn: Ngaka. van Zyl a re setlhopha sa Facebook sa “screen-her-save-her” se teng go ka dirisiwa ke balwetse le ba malapa a bona.

en: The mobile unit will be visiting more towns in the region over the next couple of months, including George, Knysna, Plettenberg Bay, Oudtshoorn, and Riversdale.
tsn: Re na le balwetse ba ba kileng ba nna le kankere, ba ba fetileng mo thulaganyong e yotlhe mo malobeng, ba ba  leng teng go thusa balwetse ba bašwa ka go bua fela le bona le go abelana le bona ka maitemogelo a bona, ka gonne o ka se bolelele ba bangwe ka sengwe se o se nang maitemogelo a sona.

en: The Academy Awards, or Oscars, will be handed out at a ceremony in Los Angeles on Sunday and broadcast live on ABC television.
tsn: Yuniti e e tsamaisiwang e, e tlaa etela ditoropo di le dintsi mo kgaolong mo dikgweding di le mmalwa tse di latelang ya dikgwedi di le mmalwa, go akaretsa George, Knysna, Plettenberg Bay, Oudtshoorn le Riversdale.

en: The South African-made documentary My Octopus Teacher, which won the British Academy Film Awards (BAFTA) for Best Documentary, is also nominated for an Oscar.
tsn: Dikgele tsa Akatemi, kgotsa di Oscars, di tlaa neelwa kwa moletlong wa kwa Los Angeles ka Sontaga me di tlaa gasiwa kwa tlhamalalo mo thelebišeneng ya ABC.

en: The film was directed by Pippa Ehrlich and James Reed and features diver Craig Foster as he befriends an octopus living in the kelp forests in the waters of False Bay.
tsn: Lenaneo la tshedimosetso “My Octopus Teacher” le le dirilweng mo Afrorikaborwa, le le ikgapetseng sekgele kwa moletlong wa dikgele wa Akatemi ya wa Britain (BAFTA) jaaka lenaneo la tshedimosetso le le gaisang, le lona le tlhophilwe gore e ikgapele sekgele sa Oscar.

en: Britain’s Prince William and his wife Kate published a photograph of their youngest child Louis to mark his third birthday on Friday.
tsn: Filimi e, e ne e tsamaisiwa ke Pippa Ehrlich le James Reed, mme e ne e akaretsa gape le mothumi, Craig Foster jaaka a ne a aga botsalano le oketopase e e tshelang ka mot lase ga metsing a sekgwa sa Kelp kwa False Bay.

en: The photograph was taken by Kate at Kensington Palace, the family’s home in London, shortly before Louis left for his first day at a nearby nursery school.
tsn: Kgosana ya kwa Britain, William le mosadi wa gagwe Kate ba phasaladitse setshwantsho sa ngwana wa bona yo mmotlana Louis, fa ba ne ba teteka letsatsi la gagwe la matsalo la boraro ka Labotlhano.

en: The picture showed Louis smiling on a red bicycle with a school bag strapped on his back.
tsn: Setshwantsho se tserwe ke Kate kwa paleising ya kwa ga Kensington, legae la lelapa le kwa London, pelenyana fela ga gore Louis a ye kwa sekolong sa tlhokomelo se se gaufinyana lwa ntlha.

en: Tokyo will not host its motor show this year because of the global pandemic, organizers said on Thursday, underscoring Japan’s struggle to contain both a resurgent COVID-19 outbreak and the widening economic fall-out.
tsn: Setshwantsho se bontsha Louis a nyenya, a palame baesekele e e khibidu, a belege kgetse ya gagwe ya sekolo mo mokwatleng.

en: The cancellation comes as the government is expected to issue a third state of emergency for Tokyo and a number of other prefectures that could last for about two weeks, according to media reports.
tsn: Tokyo ga e kitla e tshwara moletlo wa yona wa dikoloi ngwaga o ka ntlha ya leroborobo le le tlhasetseng lefatshe ka bophara, barulaganyi ba buile jalo ka Labone, ba gatelela kgwetlho e ba kwa Japan ba lebaneng le yona ya go laola leroborobo la COVID-19 le mathata a ikonomi a ntseng a atologa

en: The halting of the auto show, a marquee event of the country’s most important industry, is also likely to raise more questions about the government’s insistence that the relayed Tokyo Olympics will go ahead this summer.
tsn: Go phimolwa ga moletlo o go tla ka nako e puso e solofetsweng go baya Tokyo ka mo tlase ga maemo a tshoganyetso, le dintlha tse dingwe di le mmalwa tse di ka tsayang dibeke tse pedi gore di fete, go ya ka dipegelo tsa bobegakgang.

en: The chairman of the Japan Automobile Manufacturers Association, Akio Toyoda, said the group felt it was difficult to provide a safe environment amid surging coronavirus cases.
tsn: Kemiso ya moletlo o wa dikoloi, moletlo wa Intaseteri e e botlhokwa thata mo nageng, e ka tsosa dipotso di le dintsi ka ga tshusumetso ya puso ya gore Diolimpiki tsa kwa Tokyo di tlaa tswelela pele selemo se.

en: The show is normally held around late October to early November.
tsn: Modulasetulo wa Mokgatlho wa badiri ba dikoloi kwa Japan, Akio Toyoda, o rile setlhopha se lemogile gore go thata go tlamela tikologo e e babalesegileng mo nakong e ka ntlha ya dipalo tse di ntseng di oketsega tsa coronavirus.

en: Such cancellations are bad news for an economy that like many around the world, has been badly hit by the pandemic.
tsn: Go le gantsi moletlo o o tshwarwa fa kgwedi ya Diphalane e ya kwa bokhutlong, go ya kwa tshimologong ya kgwedi ya Ngwanaatsele.

en: Some analysts said another state of emergency could push Japan back into recession if retailers are asked to close during the Golden Week holidays, which start next week and run through early May.
tsn: Go phimolwa go ga meletlo, ke dikgang tse bosula mo ikonoming e jaaka diikonimi tse dingwe lefatshe ka bophara e tlhasetsweng ke leroborobo.

en: The risk of a double-dip recession has clearly heightened, said Hiroshi Shiraishi, senior economist at BNP Paribas Securities.
tsn: Basekaseki ba bangwe ba re, go bewa gape ga Japan ka mo tlase ga maemo a tshoganyetso, go ka digela ikonomi ya Japan kwa tlase. Fa bagwebipotlana ba ka kopiwa go tswala ka nako ya malatsi a boikhutso, a a simololang mo bekeng e e tlang, mme a tswelele go fitlha kwa tshimologong ya kgwedi ya Motsheganong.

en: The impact of imposing curbs on Tokyo and Osaka alone would be quite big.
tsn: Mathata a kwelotlase ya ikonomi a ile kwa godimo thata, go bua Hiroshi Shiraishi, Raikonomimogolo wa kwa BNP, Paribas Securities.

en: Japan has so far avoided an explosive spread of the pandemic that has plagued many Western countries, with total cases so far about 540 000 and a death toll of 9 707.
tsn: Ditlamorago tsa go tseya tirisong melao ya thibelo kwa Tokyo le Osaka e ka nna tse dikgolo thata.

en: But the latest rise in infections has stoked alarm, coming just three months before the planned start of the Tokyo Olympics and amid a sluggish vaccination roll out.
tsn: Go fitlhelela ga jaana, Japan e kgonne go thibela kanamo ya leroborobo le le tlhasetseng dinaga di le dintsi tsa kwa Bophirima, ka palo ya dikgetse tse di fitlhang go 540 000 ga jaana le palo ya dintsho di le 9 707.

en: Tokyo 2020 organizers said a policeman who worked with the Olympic torch relay in western Kagawa prefecture had tested positive for the virus.
tsn: Mme tlhatlogo ya ditshwaetso ya ga jaana e tshositse ba le bantsi, e tla dikgwedi di le tharo pele ga letlha la go simolola diolompiki kwa Tokyo le nako e e bonya ya go simolola ka tsamaiso ya meento.

en: With thousands of new cases resulting from highly infectious strain of the virus, Prime Minister Yoshihide Suga said on Wednesday the government will decide this week whether to declare the state of emergency for major parts of the country.
tsn: Barulaganyi ba Tokyo 2020 ba re diteko tsa lepodisi le le neng le dira le ba torch Relay kwa diolimpiking kwa Bophirima jwa Kagawa, di bontshitse fa a na le mogare.

en: The governors of Tokyo’s neighbouring Saitama, Chiba and Kanagawa prefectures will request the same emergency measures as the capital, the Nikkei newspaper reported.
tsn: Ka diketekete tsa dikgetse tse dintšhwa tse di bakwang ke mogare yo o tshelanwang, Tonakgolo Yoshihide Suga o rile ka Laboraro, puso e tlaa swetsa mo bekeng e gore, a e tlaa baya dikarolo tse di botlhokwa tsa naga ka mo tlase ga maemo a tshoganyetso kgotsa nnyaa.

en: Four western prefectures are also seeking emergency measures, media have reported, bringing businesses in the large swathes of the country under tighter operating hours.
tsn: Babusi ba dikgaolo tse di agisaneng le Tokyo e leng Saitama, Chiba le Kanagawa ba tlaa tsenya kopo e e tshwanang ya maemo a tshoganyetso jaaka Khepetlele, go bega kuranta ya Nikkei.

en: The government is considering imposing the curbs from April 25 to May 11, Jiji news agency reported.
tsn: Dikgaolo di le nne tsa Bophirima le tsona di batla go tsaya dikgato tsa maemo a tshoganyetso, metswedi ya dikgang e begile, e dira gore dikgaolo tse dikgolo tsa naga di dire ka fa tlase ga kgatelelo ya nako.

en: It is also expected to weigh stronger curbs than those issued last time in January, such as requests for department stores and other big retailers to close.
tsn: Puso e akanya go tsenya tirisong thibelo ya dilo di le mmalwa go tloga ka la 25 Moranang go ya ka 11 Motsheganong, Mokgatlho wa dikgang wa Jiji o begile.

en: We need to take stronger and more targeted steps than before including requests (for shops) to close, Economy Minister Yasutoshi Nishimura was quoted as saying by Kyodo news agency on Thursday.
tsn: E solofetswe gape gore e tsenye tirisong melao ya thibelo e e gagametseng go feta e e neng e tsentswe tirisong ka kgwedi ya Ferikgong, e e tshwanang le go tsenya kopo ya gore dikgebopotlana le dikgwebo tse dingwe tse dikgolo di tswalwe.

en: Tokyo reported 861 new cases on Thursday, the most since January 29 during the third wave of the pandemic and previous state of emergency.
tsn: Re tshwanetse go tsaya dikgato tse di gagametseng thata go feta tse re di tsereng mo nakong e e fetileng, go akaretsa dikopo tsa go tswalwa ga mabenkele. Tona ya ekonomi Yasutoshi Nishimura one a nopolwa ke baemedi ba lekwalodikgang la Kyodo Ka Labone.

en: Osaka prefecture reported 1 167, down slightly from a record.
tsn: Tokyo e begile dikgetse di le 861 tse dintšhwa ka Labone, palo e e kwa godimo fa e sale ka di 29 tsa kgwedi ya Ferikgong, ka nako ya lekhubu la boraro  la leroborobo le maemo a tshoganyetso a mo nakong e e fetileng.

en: Japan’s economy has emerged from last year’s severe slump thanks to robust exports.
tsn: Kgaolo ya Osaka e begile dikgetse di le 1 167, palo e e leng kwa tlasenyana go tswa mo rekotong.

en: But analysts expect GDP to have shrunk in the first quarter due to the hit to consumption from the second emergency curbs that rolled out in January and say a second consecutive contraction in Q2 that would constitute a recession is possible.
tsn: Ikonomi ya kwa Japan e neng e le mo maemong a a kwa tlase mo ngwageng o o fetileng, e kgonne go tlhatloga, re leboga thomelo e e maatla ya diromelwantle.

en: The timing is not good, as it would hit service spending during the spring leisure season, said Takumi Tsunoda, senior economist at Shinkin Central Bank Research Institute, of the latest curbs.
tsn: Mme basekaseki ba solofela fa GDP e fokotsegile mo kotareng ya ntlha ka ntlha ya maemo a bobedi a tshoganyetso, a a simolotseng ka kgwedi ya Ferikgong mme a re fa go ka latela a bobedi mo kotareng ya bobedi, maemo a itsholelo a naga a tlaa ya kwa tlase thata.

en: Tsunoda cut his forecast for second-quarter GDP to a 0.5% quarter-on-quarter rise, half the previously projected pace.
tsn: Nako e, ga e se e e siameng jaaka e ka ama ditirelo ka nako ya dikgagologo ya boitapoloso, go bua  Takumi Tsunoda, Raikonomimogolo kwa setheong sa dipatlisiso sa Central Bank, ka ga dithibelo tsa morago jaana.

en: Four thousand people will attend the BRIT Awards next month, in what organisers of Britain’s pop music honours said would be the first major indoor music event with a live audience as the country emerges from COVID-19 lockdown.
tsn: Tsunoda o fokoleditse tekanyetso ya gagwe ya  kotara ya bobedi  go 0.5 GDP, halofo ya lobelo lo lo neng lo solofetswe mo nakong e e fetileng.

en: The ceremony, to be held on May 11 at London’s O2 Arena, will form part of the UK governments Events Research Programme, looking at whether major events can take place in closed environments without social distancing.
tsn: Dikete di le nne tsa batho di tlaa tsenela dikabelo tsa dikgele tsa BRIT mo kgweding e e tlang, mo go se barulaganyi ba tlotlo ya mmino wa Pop ba kwa Britain ba se kaileng jaaka moletlo wa ntlha wa mmino, o o tlaa tshamekelwang mo teng ga kago mme go na le babogedi, jaaka naga e tswa mo seemong sa kiletsomesepele ka ntlha ya COVID-19.

en: This means audience members, of which 2 500 will be keyworkers who will be gifted tickets, will not have to wear facemasks inside the arena but will have to provide proof of a negative lateral flow test result to enter the venue.
tsn: Moletlo o o tlaa tshwarwang ka la 11 Motsheganong kwa O2 Arena kwa London, e tlaa nna karolo ya porogerama ya dipadipatlisiso tsa puso kwa UK, go lebelela gore a meletlo e megolo e ka tshwarelwa mo mafelong a a tswaleging kwa ntle ga go katogana ga batho.

en: They will also have to take a test after the ceremony and provide contact details as part of the country’s COVID-19 test and trace system.
tsn: Se se raya gore babogedi, ba e leng gore ba le 2 500 ba bona ke badiri ba botlhokwa ba ba tlabong ba filwe ditekethe, ga ba kitla ba apara dimaseke ka mo gare ga lefelo leo, mme ba tlaa tshwanelwa ke go neelana ka bopaki jwa teko ya tlhatlhobo e e senang tshwaetso pele ga ba ka tsena mo lefelong leo.

en: This has been a long tough year for everyone and I’m delighted the night will honour the key worker heroes who have cared for us so well during that time and continue to do so, singer Dua Lipa, who is nominated for four awards, said in a statement.
tsn: Ba tlaa tshwanelwa ke go tsaya teko morago ga moletlo le go tlamela ka dintlha tsa tlhbona tsa tlhaeletsano jaaka karolo ya naga ya go leka go laola COVID-19.

en: They are quite simply an inspiration.
tsn: Ngwaga o, o nnile boima e bile o nnile moleele go mongwe le mongwe, mme ke itumeletse gore bosigo jo, bo tlaa tlotla badiri ba botlhokwa, ba bagaka ba ba neng ba re tlhokometse sentle thata ka nako eo, e bile ba tswelela go dira jalo, seopedi, Dua Lipa, yo o tlhophilweng mo di karolong di le nne tsa dikgele, o buile jalo.

en: The BRIT Awards are always special, and this will truly make it a night to remember.
tsn: Ka mafoko a a bonolo, ke batho ba ba nang le tlhotlheletso e ntle.

en: Lipa is among several singers who will perform at the event, the first live music show at the O2 in more than a year.
tsn: Dikabelo tsa dikgele tsa BRIT ke tse di kgethegileng ka dinako tsotlhe mme se, se tlaa dira gore bosigo jo, e nne jo bo tlaa gakologelwang.

en: Under Prime Minister Boris Johnsons phased roadmap out of lockdown, entertainment venues can re-open their doors next month.
tsn: Lipa ke mongwe wa diopedi di le mmalwa tse di tlaa diragatsang kwa moletlong o. Moletlo wa ntlha wa mmino kwa O2 mo nakong e e fetang ngwaga.

en: Not only will we be celebrating the brilliant music and artists that have helped us through the pandemic, but we hope it will provide a path for the return of live music that fans and artists have so sorely missed, said Geoff Taylor, chief executive of the British Phonographic Industry and the BRITs.
tsn: Ka fa tlase ga tsamaiso ya ga Tonakgolo Boris Johnsons ya lenaneo la go tsenngwa ga lockdown, mafelo a boitumediso a ka bulwa gape mo

en: We’re buzzing about the show and working closely with government, the O2 and all our partners to ensure all safety measures and guidelines are adhered to.
tsn: kgweding e e tlang.

en: Behind an inconspicuous black door on a stairwell in New York’s 28th Street subway station, the person in the know will find cocktail lounge La Noxe.
tsn: Re tlabo re sa keteke fela mmino o o monate le dibini tse di re thusitseng ka nako ya leroborobo, mme re solofela gore se, se tlaa neelana ka tsela ya go busediwa ga mmino o barati ba mmino le dibini ba neng ba o tlhwaofaletse thata, go bua Geoff Taylor, Mokhuduthamaga wa intaseteri fonokerafi ya kwa Britain le BRIT.

en: The roughly 46-square-metre dimly lit bar is an oasis from the street noise and the screeching of the trains as they grind to a halt.
tsn: Re itumetse thata ka ga moletlo o le go dira mmogo le puso, O2 le batho ba re kopanetseng kgwebo le bona go netefatsa gore melao yotlhe ya pabalesego le dikaelo e a obamelwa.

en: I think it’s almost a bit like Alice in Wonderland-esque, said La Noxe founder, Jey Perie.
tsn: Kwa morago ga kgoro e e sa sa bonaleng sentle kwa mmileng wa 28 kwa seteišheneng sa terena kwa New York, motho yo o itseng o tlaa fitlhela lefelo la boitapoloso le le bidiwang La Noxe.

en: The energy that you have in the subway, there’s like a very tough energy, like people going from A to B, and then the rush and you’re underground.
tsn: Bara e e bogolo jo bo lekanang le dimetara di le 46 ya mabone a a kganyelang kwa tlase, ga e kgakala le mmmila o o modumo, le modumo o o dirwang ke diterena fa di ema tsi!

en: And then you enter here and it’s more like velvet and warm colors and flowers and carpets, he said.
tsn: Ke akanya gore e batlile e tshwana le Alice in wonderland, go bua mosimolodi wa Noxe, Jey Perie.

en: I like the dichotomy of it, that contrast between the roughness of the New York streets and energy, then here it’s very peaceful.
tsn: Botlhaga jo batho ba nnang le jona kwa seteišheneng sa diterena, go na le mowa wa botlhaga o o kwa godimo, jaaka batho ba tswa mo go A, ba ya kwa go B, le go itlhaganela ga bona, ka nako e o, o tsamaya ka fa tlase ga dikago.

en: Perie said he was initially hesitant to set up the bar in the space because it was so small.
tsn: Mme jaanong fa o tsena fa, go tshwana le belebete le mebala e e bothito le dithunya le dikhapete, a rialo.

en: But I fell in love with the location and the fact that its inside of a subway station is insane and its very unique, he said.
tsn: Ke rata pharologanyo ya teng. Pharologano magareng ga mebila ya kwa New York e e makgwakgwa le botlhaga jwa teng, mme fa gona go na le kagiso.

en: Like many restaurants and bars affected by the pandemic, La Noxe (pronounced La Noche) was originally slated to open in March 2020 but delayed its opening until last October.
tsn: Perie a re  o ne kwa tshimologong a okaoka go bula bara mo lefelong leo ka ntlha ya fa le le nnye tota.

en: Perie says the novelty bars popularity is now another challenge and that it has a 2 000-person waiting list.
tsn: Mme ke ne ka simolola go rata lefelo le, le ntlha ya gore le ka fa tlase ga seteišhene sa diterene e ya itumedisa ebile e tlhaolegileng, a rialo.

en: The problem is, we’re tiny, he said.
tsn: Jaaka bontsi jwa diresetšhurente le bara di amilwe ke leroborobo, La Noxe (e e bidiwang La Noche ) e ne e tshwanetse go bulwa ka kgwedi ya Mopitlwe 2020, mme ba diegisa go bulwa ga yona go fitlha ka kgwedi ya Diphalane.

en: Only like 10 people, 12 people can be here at the same time and (with) reduced hours due to COVID, we can now only operate from like 5 p.m., 6 p.m. to midnight.
tsn: Perie a re, go tuma ga bara e ke kgwetlho e nngwe e ba lebaneng le yona, le gore, go na le batho ba le 2 000 ba ba santseng ba letile go ya kwa teng.

en: Perie, who was born in the south of France and has lived in Barcelona, Hong Kong and Tokyo, said he fell in love with New York because of its diversity.
tsn: Bothata ke gore, ke felo le le nnye, a rialo.

en: Luxury carmaker Ferrari on Wednesday unveiled initial details of its new supercar, the first of three new models it has promised for the coming months.
tsn: Re kgona go amogela batho ba le 10 kgotsa 12 fela ka nako e le nngwe mme ka lebaka la go fokodiwa ga diura ka ntlha ya COVID -19, re kgona do dira fela go tloga ka 5 kgotsa 6 wa maitseboa, go fitlhelela bosigogare.

en: An aggressive roll-out plan of new models, which was not delayed last year by the COVID-19 pandemic, has been a key part of the company’s recent strategy to support growth.
tsn: Perie,  yo o belegetswe kwa Borwa jwa France, mme a kile a nna kwa Barcelona, Hong Kong le Tokyo, a re o ratile New York ka ntlha ya pharologano e e leng teng koo.

en: The Shakespeare Schools Festival of South Africa that got off to a disappointing opening earlier this week due to the devastating fire in Cape Town has resumed.
tsn: Badiri ba dikoloi tsa Manobonobo Ferrari, ka Laboraro e bontshitse dintlha tsa koloi ya bona e ntšhwa, ya ntlha ya mefuta e le meraro e ba solofeditseng go e ntsha mo dikgweding tse di tlang.

en: The opening was cancelled after the emergency situation in the Mother City, but the eleventh edition is now in full force until the weekend.
tsn: Leano la go ntsha mefuta e mešwa, le le neng le sa kgorelediwa ke COVID-19 mo ngwageng o o fetileng, e ne e le karolo e e botlhokwa ya gotshegetsa kgolo ya setlamo se.

en: About 15 schools and amateur groups are presenting abridged versions of well-known Shakespeare plays at the Artscape Theatre, in the heart of Cape Town.
tsn: Moletlo wa Dikolo wa Shakespeare wa Aforikaborwa, o o simolotseng ka go swabisa go sa le gale mo bekeng e ka ntlha ya molelo o o tlhasetseng kwa Cape Town, o tsweletse pele.

en: Five troupes are simultaneously playing at the Masque Theatre in Muizenberg.
tsn: Pulo e, e ne ya fedisiwa morago ga maemo a tshoganyetso kwa Mother City, mme legato la bo 11 le tsweletse pele ka maatla go fitlha mafelo a beke.

en: The event, which promotes life skills by focusing on literacy, classic literature and the arts, is also streamed to Russia, Estonia and Malawi.
tsn: Dikolo di ka nna 15 le ditlhopha tsa bomagogorwane ba tlhagisa metshameko e e khutswafaditsweng ya motshameko o o itsegeng thata wa ga Shakespeare kwa bobogelong jwa Artscape, mo gare ga pelo ya Cape Town.

en: Over the years it has become Africa’s largest Shakespeare youth drama programme.
