en: With the recent easing of restrictions and the current holiday period, we will just have to wait and see if it will have any effect on the infection rates.
tsn: Go ya ka go nolofatswa ga melao le malatsi a boikhutso a bošeng jaana, re tlaa tshwanna ke go emela le go bona gore go tlaa nna le seabe mo palong ya go tshwaetsego.

en: If we look at the curves of all the provinces, all of them have shown slight spikes in the last couple of weeks.
tsn: Fa re lebelela gogoropela ya diporofenseng tsotlhe, di bontshitse koketsego mo dibekeng tse di fetileng.

en: None of them are still on a sustained decline, he explains.
tsn: Ga go na epe ya tsona e e sa ntse e fokotsega, o a tlhalosa.

en: Discussing South Africas COVID-19 status with Dr Ridhwaan Suliman:
tsn: Go buisanwa le Ngaka Ridhwaan Suliman ka maemo a Covid-19 mo Aforikaborwa.

en: The Commission of Inquiry into State Capture says it understands that the public wants it to complete its hearings and work but says an extension is needed to do it properly.
tsn: Khomišene ya Dipatlisiso ya puso ya re  e tlhaloganya gore setšhaba se batla gore e fetse ditheetso tsa yone le tiro mme ya re katoloso e a tlhokega go dira dilo sentle.

en: The Commission announced on Thursday morning it would be applying to the North Gauteng High Court in Pretoria for a three month extension of its deadline.
tsn: Khomišene e dirile kitsiso ka Labone mo mosong gore e ya go dira kopo ya katoloso ya dikgwedi di le tharo tsa letlha le le beilweng la yona kwa kgotlatshekelo e e kwa godimo ya kwa Bokone Gauteng kwa Pretoria.

en: Oral evidence will be completed by the end of July, while the report will be finalised by the end of September.
tsn: Bopaki ka molomo bo tlaa wediwa kwa bokhutlong jwa kgwedi ya Phukwi, fa pegelo e tlaa konosediwa kwa bokhutlong jwa Lwetse.

en: The Commission was supposed to have finished oral hearings by the end of last month.
tsn: Khomišene e ne e tshwanetse go fetsa ditheetso tsa molomo ka mafelo a kgwedi e e fetileng.

en: DCJ says the commission will still continue to hear the evidence of other 5or 6 implicated witnesses including the evidence of the President in his capacity as the President of ANC and the President of the country.
tsn: DCJ a re khomišene e tlaa nna e tswelelapele ka go utlwa bosupi jwa dipaki le tlhano kgotsa thataro tse di amegang, go akaretsa bosupi jwa Moporesidente mo tirong ya gagwe ya go nna Moporesidente wa ANC le Moporesitente wa naga.

en: Deputy Chief Justice Raymond Zondo says the extension is important given that they have to hear evidence from another six implicated people including President Cyril Ramaphosa.
tsn: Motlatsa Moatlhodimogolo Raymond Zondo a re katoloso e botlhokwa ka gore ba tshwanetse go utlwa bosupi go tswa mo bathing ba bangwe ba ba amegang ba le thataro go akaretsa Moporesidente Cyril Ramaphosa.

en: But the one thing I will not do is this, I will not end the work of the Commission in an irresponsible manner.
tsn: Mme selo se le sengwe se nka se sedireng ke se, nka se feleletse tiro ya Khomišene ka mokgwa o sa siamang.

en: I am going to repeat that, I will not end the work of the Commission in an irresponsible manner, just because I want to satisfy those that demand that the Commission should finish its work.
tsn: Ke tlile go boeletsa gore nka se feleletse tiro ya Khomišene ka mokgwa o sa siamang, fela ka gore ke batla kgotsofatsa bao ba batlang  gore Khomišene e tshwanetse go fetsa tiro ya yona.

en: When [we] started at this Commission, I made it quite clear that this Commission would do its work properly.
tsn: Fa re ne re simolola Khomišene eno, ke dirile gore go utlwagale sentle gore Khomišene e, e tlaa dira tiro ya yona ka tshwanelo.

en: In seeking to complete hearings of oral evidence we will act properly and in [a] responsible manner, adds Zondo.
tsn: Mo go batleng go tlatsa ditheetso tsa bosupi jwa molomo, re tla dira tshwanelo le ka maikarabelo, a bolela jalo Zondo.

en: Today’s proceedings below.
tsn: Tatelano ya ditiragalo tsa gompieno fa tlase.

en: The Judicial Commission of Inquiry into allegations of State Capture is to apply to the High Court this afternoon for an extension of its hearings.
tsn: Khomišene ya Dipatlisiso ya Bosiamisi ya ditatofatso tsa puso ya go dira kopo  ya katoloso ya ditheetso tsa yona kwa kgotlatshekelo e e kwa godimo mo thapameng e.

en: The Commission wants an extension from July to September.
tsn: Khomišene e batla katoloso go tsweng kgwedi ya Phukwi go ya go Lwetse.

en: Commission chair Deputy Chief Justice Raymond Zondo elaborates why they went beyond their June deadline.
tsn: Motlatsa Moatlhodimogolo  wa Khomišene Raymond Zondo o tlhalositse gore, goreng ba ne ba feta letlha le le beilweng la bona la Seetebosigo.

en: The assessment that was made was made in good faith but it just did not work out.
tsn: Tshekatsheko e e dirilweng e dirilwe ka tshwanelo tumelo mme gagwa direga jalo.

en: The evidence that still needed to be heard beyond the end of March was very important evidence, it included the evidence of former senior executives of SOEs such as Transnet and Eskom.
tsn: Bosupi bo bo neng bo tlhokega go reediwa go feta bokhutlong jwa kgwedi ya Mopitlwe bo ne bo le botlhokwa thata, bo ne bo akaretsa bosupi jwa bokhuduthamaga ba maloba ba di SOEs jaaka Transnet le Eskom.

en: DCJ says the commission did not have hearings recently and that its term will come to an end at the end of June, he says when the commission applied for the extension from the end of March to the end of June.
tsn: DCJ a re Khomišene e ne e se na ditheetso bošeng jaana mme paka ya yona e tlaa khutla kwa bokhutlong jwa kgwedi ya Seetebosigo, a re fa Khomišene e ne e dira kopo ya katoloso ya go tswa kwa bokhutlong jwa kgwedi ya Mopitlwe go ya kwa bokhutlong jwa kgwedi ya Seetebosigo.

en: The Commission resumed today with oral evidence from former Transnet CFO Anoj Singh and will also hear evidence from former public enterprise minister Malusi Gigaba tonight.
tsn: Gompieno Khomišene e tsweletsepele ka bopaki jwa molomo go tswa mo CFO ya Transnet Anoj Singh mme e tlaa utlwa gape le bopaki go tswa mo go kgoduthamaga wa setšhaba wa tsa dikgwebo wa puso ya maloba Malusi Gigaba mo maitseboeng ano.

en: Zondo this week announced that the Commission has limited time to wrap up its oral evidence and dismissed most of the applications for leave to cross-examine.
tsn: Zondo beke e, o begile gore Khomišene e na le nako e e  tlhomilweng go konosetsa bosupi jwa molomo mme ya koba bontsi jwa dikopo tsa go tlogela go botsolotsa.

en: Some political parties say there is nothing to celebrate this Youth Day if more than 60% of young people are unemployed and trapped in poverty.
tsn: Makoko a mang a sepolotiki a re ga go na sepe se se ka ketekelwang Letsatsi la Bašwa lena, fa go na le diphesente di ka feta 60(%) tsa bašwa ba ba sa direng e bile ba katlilwe mo lehumeng.

en: Exactly 45 years ago on this day, thousands of young people took to the streets to protest the mandatory use of Afrikaans as a medium of instruction in Black schools.
tsn: Ke di ngwaga di le 45 tse di fetileng ka letsatsi le, fa dikete tsa bašwa ba ne ba ya  go dira ditshupetso tsa tiriso ya taolelo ya go rutwa ka mo dikolong tsa bantsho ka puo ya Seburu.

en: Many of them were killed, some were arrested while others including their leader Tsietsi Mashinini, went into exile.
tsn: Bontsi jwa bona ba ne ba bolawa, bangwe ba tshwarwa fa ba bangwe ba bona go akarediwa le moeteledipele wa bona Tsietsi Mashinini ba ne ba ya botshabelo.

en: Until 1994, many of them were killed in the struggle against the apartheid oppressive regime, while hundreds of those who left the country, joined liberation armies of the African National Congress (ANC), Pan Africanist Congress of Azania (PAC) and Azanian Peoples Organisation (Azapo).
tsn: Go fitlha ka 1994, bontsi jwa bona ba ne ba bolawa mo kgaratlhong kgatlhanong le puso ya kgatelelo ya tlhaolele, mme fa makgolokgolo a ba bangwe ba tlogela naga, ba tsenelena sesole sa tokologo sa African National Congress (ANC), (Pan Africanist Congress ya Azania (PAC) le Azanian People’s Organisation (Azapo).

en: Decades later, some political parties say life is still tough for young people even under the democracy,citing unemployment and their daily struggle to overcome poverty.
tsn: Morago ga dingwagasome di le dintsi, makoko a mang sepolotiki a re botshelo bo sa ntse bo le thata mo bašweng le ka fa tlase temokerasi, go lebilwe botlhokatiro le botlhoki jwa bona ba go fenya kgaratlho ya bone ya letsatsi le letsatsi.

en: Democratic Alliance leader, John Steenhuisen, says only his party has what it takes to turn the situation around.
tsn: Moeteledipele wa Democratic Alliance John Steenhuisen, a re ke lekoko la gagwe fela le le nang le bokgoni ba go fetola seemo.

en: DA commemorates Youth Day:
tsn: DA e gakologelwa Letsatsi la Bašwa:

en: Congress of the People spokesperson, Dennis Bloem, says to overcome youth unemployment, government needs to introduce a training scheme for young people.
tsn: Mmueledi wa COPE, Dennis Bloem a re go fenya botlhokatiro jwa bašwa, puso e tshwanetse go tlhagisa sekema sa katiso ya bašwa.

en: Zama Ntshona, from the African Transformation Movement (ATM), says all the challenges that the 1976 generation was fighting against during apartheid, remain.
tsn: Zama Ntshona wa mokgatlho wa African Transformation Movement (ATM), a re dikgwetlho tsotlhe tsa  bašwa ba 1976 tse ba neng ba di lwela kgatlhanong le tlhaolele di sa ntse.

en: The National Freedom Partys Secretary General, Canaan Mdhletshe, says government should make it easy for young people to open their businesses and realise their potential.
tsn: Mokwaledi kakaretso wa National Freedom Party , Canaan Mdhletshe a re puso e tshwanetse go dira gore go nne bonolo go baša go kwadisa dikgwebo tsa bona gore ba kgone go fitlhelela bokgoni jwa bone ka botlalo.

en: The concerns and suggestions come as government continues efforts to find a solution to the staggering youth unemployment rate.
tsn: Matshwenyego le ditshitshinyo di tswelela jaaka puso e tswelapele go dira maiteko a go bona tharabololo ya botlhokatiro jo bo boitshegang jwa bašwa.

en: During his Youth Day address, President Cyril Ramaphosa launched the National Pathway Management Network to assist in reducing high youth unemployment.
tsn: Ka nako ya go bua ya Moporesidente Cyril Ramaphosa ka letsatsi la bašwa, o simolotse Tsamaiso ya Bosetšhaba ya Tsela ya go thusa go fokotsa palo e e kwa godimo ya botlhokatiro jwa bašwa.

en: The initiative brings together eight government departments to form a network of support for the country’s youth to find ways to access the economy.
tsn: Maiteko a go dira mmogo le mafapha a puso a go tlhoma mafaratlhatlha a go tshegetsa bašwa  banaga go bona ditsela tsa go nna le phitlhelelo ya ikonomi.

en: President Cyril Ramaphosa’s Youth Day address in the video below:
tsn: Puo ya Moporesidente Cyril Ramaphosa ya letsatsi la mo bidio e e fa tlase:

en: Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF) leader, Julius Malema, has appealed to the youth of South Africa not to give up and to continue to educate themselves.
tsn: Moeteledipele wa Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF) Julius Malema, o kopile baša ba Aforikaborwa gore ba se ka ba itlhoboga mme tswelepele ka go ithuta.

en: Malema was speaking at Horskool Uitsig in Centurion, Pretoria, in commemoration of the June 1976 student uprising.
tsn: Malema o a ne a bua kwa sekolong se se golo sa Uitsig kwa Centurion, Pretoria, go gopola dikhuduego tsa baithuti ba 1976 Seetebosigo.

en: He says education is the key to success and therefore the youth must grab that opportunity.
tsn: A re thuto ke senotlele sa katlego mme ka jalo bašwa ba tshwanetse go dirisa tšhono eo.

en: Malema says the youth should draw inspiration from the likes of the late struggle icon, Hector Pieterson, who died this day in 1976.
tsn: Malema a re bašwa ba tshwanetse go tsaya thotloetso go tswa go mothosetšhabeng wa kgaratlho jaaka Hector Pieterson yo a tlhokafetseng, ka letsatsi le ka 1976.

en: He left us with enough material to revive us, to equip us, to inspire us as Black people and to continue the good fight.
tsn: O re sile ka kitso e e a lekaneng gore re itsosolose, re ithute, le go retlhotlheletsa jaaka batho ba bantsho le go tsweletsa go lwela se se siameng.

en: We are not the type that will just sit back and say we complain, thats not why we are here.
tsn: Ga re batho ba go nna fela mme re ngongorega, ga se ka mogo re leng fano.

en: We are here to say to every White man, there is a place for every Black person in South Africa including here, he says.
tsn: Re fano go bolelela basweu, gore motho mongwe le mongwe yo montsho o na le lefelo mo Aforikaborwa go akarediwa le fano, o ne a bolela jalo.

en: The EFF leader says Petersons death must be solely blamed on former South African Prime Minister, John Vorster.
tsn: Go ya ka moeteledipele wa EFF, tonakgolo ya maloba ya Aforikaborwa John Vorster, o tshwanetswe go supiwa ka monwana mo losong la ga Pietersons.

en: He says Vorster presided over the death of many young people in the country, for merely fighting for their rights as young people.
tsn: A re Vorster o na le seabe mo dintshong tse dintsi tsa bašwa ba bantsi mo nageng, fela go lwela ditshwanelo tsa bona jaaka batho ba bašwa.

en: They don’t repeat the name, they don’t hypnotise you with the name of a murder who killed our people in 1976.
tsn: Ga ba boeletse leina, ga ba laole mogolo wa gago ka leina la motho yo a ne a bolaya batho ba rona ka 1976.

en: John Vorster is responsible for 1976, John Vorster is responsible for the murder of Hector Peterson.
tsn: John Vorster o na le maikarabelo a 1976, John Vorster o na le maikarabelo a polao ya ga Hector Peterson.

en: And AKK those who came after him, because they did not prosecute him they too have got blood of Hector Peterson, he told EFF supporters.
tsn: Le ba AKK ba ba tlileng morago ga gagwe, le bone ba na le madi a Hector Peterson mo diatleng tsa bone ka gonne ga ba mo otlhaya, o ne a bolelela batshegetsi ba EFF.

en: EFF marks Youth Day in Centurion:
tsn: EFF e keteka Letsatsi la Bašwa kwa Centurion:

en: Vaccine woes.
tsn: Dikhutsafalo tsa Moento.

en: Malema also touched on the countrys vaccine challenges.
tsn: Malema o buile gape ka dikgwetlho tsa meento mo nageng.

en: He says his party will picket outside the South African Health Products Regulatory Authority (SAHPRA) headquarters in Pretoria on Friday next week.
tsn: A re lekoko la gagwe le tlile go dira ditshupetso kwa ntle ga mošate wa South African Health Products Regulatory Authority (SAHPRA) kwa Pretoria ka Labotlhano mo bekeng e e tlang.

en: It will be demanding that the Chinese vaccine and that of Russia be approved for use in South Africa.
tsn: E tlaa bo e batla gore moento kwa China le wa kwa Russia, e letlelelwe go ka diriswa mo Aforikaborwa.

en: He says the delay by government in driving the vaccination process is going to cost a lot of lives.
tsn: A re tiego ya puso mo go tsamaisong ya go tlhaba meento, e tlile go dira gore bontsi jwa batho ba latlhegelwe ke matshelo.

en: The EFF leader says should they not be happy, they will stage a sit-in at the house of SAHPRA CEO, Dr Boitumelo Semete-Makokotlela until their call is headed.
tsn: Moeteledipele wa EFF a re fa ba sa itumela, ba tlile go dira kgato ya go nna kwa ntle ga ntlu motlhankedimogolo wa SAHPRA, Ngaka Boitumelo Semete-makokotlela go fitlhela ba ba reetsa.

en: After picketing there next week Friday, they have seven days to approve the Russian vaccine and the Chinese vaccine, failure to do so, were do stage a sleep in at the house of the CEO of SAHPRA until they protect us, it is personal like that.
tsn: Morago ga go dira ditshupetso kwa ntle beke e e tlang ka Labotlhano, ba na le malatsi a le supa go amogela moento wa kwa Russia le moento wa China, go retelelwa ke go dira jalo, re a go dira kgato ya go robala kwa ntle ga ntlu ya motlhankedimogolo wa SAHPRA go fitlhela ba resireletsa, e re ama jalo.

en: It is personal like that.
tsn: E re ama jalo.

en: We are going to her house, we want her to approve Sputnik and Chinese vaccine to add on what we have now, he says.
tsn: Re tlile go ntlo ya gagwe, re batla go amogela sputnik le Setšhaena moento go tlaleletsa mo go se re se na jaanong, o bolela jalo.

en: South Africa is currently using the Johnson and Johnson and the Pfizer vaccine is the second phase of its vaccination programme.
tsn: Aforikaborwa ga jaanong jana e dirisa Johnson le Johnson mme moento wa Pfizer ke wa kgato ya bobedi ya go tlhaba meento.

en: The young people of South Africa are in a permanent state of depression and hopelessness.
tsn: Bašwa ba Aforikaborwa ba mo maemong a kgatelelo ya semowa a leruri le go itlhoboga.

en: Largely because we have given up the baton.
tsn: Thata thata ka gonne re itlhobogile maikarabelo.

en: All revolutions across the world were led by decisive, united and radical young people.
tsn: Ditshupo tsotlhe tsa go kgabakanya lefatshe, di ne di eteletswe pele ke bašwa ba ba neng ba dirisana mmogo, mme ba na le bokgoni jwa go dira ditshwetso tse di botlhokwa ka bonako.

en: The fact that our country is in a speedy state of demise is one that cannot be argued anymore.
tsn: Ntlha ya gore naga ya rona e mo maemong a latlhegelwa ke go laola naga ka lebelo ke ntlha e e re ka se e ganetseng.

en: The rate of youth unemployment speaks volumes.
tsn: Palo ya botlhokatiro jwa bašwa bua go le gontsi thata.

en: This dizzying 46.3% unemployment rate of young people was coming  COVID-19 or not.
tsn: Palo e ya 46.3% e e golang ka bokano ya botlhokatiro jwa bašwa e ne e tlile go nna teng le fa Covid-19 e ne sa nna teng.

en: Savanna and the Yanos (culture of excessive youth partying) have taken over, the revolution is happening there.
tsn: Savanna le ma Yanos (setso sa bašwa se se feteletseng sa meletlo) se e etelapele mme diphetogo tsotlhe di diragala teng.

en: But what about the realities that will still remain even after a night of groove?
tsn: Mme ra re eng ka maemo a ka metlha a a sa fetogeng ka fa morago ga go itumedisa bosigo kwa menateng?

en: The true liberation of this country will not happen for as long as we are still stuck in the delusion of drunkenness and twerking.
tsn: Kgololosego ya nnte ya naga e, e ka se diragale fa re sa ntse re belwa ke go iphora ka botagwa le mmino wa matheka le marago.

en: As we commemorate the 45th anniversary of the Soweto massacre, which has been renamed
tsn: Jaaka re keteka ngwaga wa bo 45 wa go gokologelwa kgailo ya bašwa kwa Soweto, e e kileng ya fetolwang leina go nna Letsatsi la Bašwa go lekwa go phefofatswa nnete ya se se diragetseng letsatsi leo, bašwa ba mo Aforikaborwa ba tshwanetse go fetola tsela e ba akanyang ka yona ka bonako mme ba tseye tiro ya Bašwa ya go lwela tokologo ya konomi ka bo bona.

en: Notwithstanding the fact that, as youth, we are within a permanent stage of depression and hopelessness, our brothers and sisters need to realise that no one is going to come to our rescue.
tsn: Go sa kgathalasege ntlha ya gore, jaaka bašwa, re mo kgatong ya leruri ya kgatelelo ya semowa le go itlhoboga, bo morrwarra le bo kgaitsadi ba rona ba tshwanetse go lemoga gore ga go ope yo o tlang go ba golola.

en: We have given too much power to old political careerists to destroy our future.
tsn: Re neile batsofe ba sepolotiki ba nang le taba fela le di porofešene tsa bone tsa sepolotiki maatla a mantsi go ripitla bokamoso jwa rona.

en: These people are busy building and cementing their careers and in doing so, they will make sure that young people do not emerge because they know clearly that once we take power  we will make sure that all criminals rot in jail.
tsn: Batho ba ba tshwaragane le go aga le go tlhabolola di porofešene tsa bone mme ka go dira jalo, ba tlile go netefatsa gore bašwa ga ba tswelepele ka ntlha ya gore ba itse sentle gore fa re tsaya maatla ao, re tlile go  netefatsa gore dasenyi botlhe ba bolela kwa kgolegelong.

en: The future belongs to us.
tsn: Bokamoso mo diatleng tsa rona.

en: All our current leaders will not be with us on earth in 2063.
tsn: Baeteledipele botlhe ba rona ba jaanong ba tlabe ba sena le rona mo lefatsheng ka 2063.

en: We are the ones who will have to account to the next generations as to why did we allow criminals to lead us and destroy the future.
tsn: Ke rona ba re tlaa bong re tshwanetse go tlhalosetsa kokomana e e tlang gore, goreng go etelela pele le go ripitla bokamoso jwa rona ke basinyi ba.

en: COVID, a blessing
tsn: COVID, lesego

en: The COVID-19 pandemic has been a blessing in disguise for young people in the country as it necessitated the urgency of technological adoption and integration into our lives.
tsn: Leroborobo la COVID-19 e nnile selo se re neng re sa se solofelang mo go bašweng bathong ba mo nageng e, ka fa e dirile batho ba itlwaetse le amogela tiriso ya thekenoloji ka bonako mo matshelong a rona.

en: The old generation is still struggling with even clicking a link to join a virtual meeting.
tsn: Kokomana ya bogologolo e sa ntse ba gakantshwa tobetsa kgolagano go tsenela kopano ka khomputara.

en: This is a field for young people to play in.
tsn: Le ke lefolo le baša ba tshwanetdeng go e tshamekelang teng.

en: Let us forget the obsession of looking for jobs because that was relevant until the end of the third industrial revolution.
tsn: A re lebaleng ka go itshwenya ka go batla tiro ka gonne, se ne se le maleba go fitlha kwa bokhutlong jwa   diphetogo tsa boraro tsa bodiredi.

en: This fourth revolution requires us to be innovative and bring about sustainable solutions.
tsn: Phetogo ya bone e batla gore re kgone go dira le go tlisa ditharabololo tse di tswelelangpele.

en: As the electoral system opens for individual candidates, young people should be ready to run for all positions, even if it means challenging a pensioner of a political organisation that you belong in.
tsn: Jaaka thulaganyo ya go dira ditlhopho e Bulelwa mang le mang, baša ba tshwanetse go nna ba e kemiseditse tsamaisa  maemong otlhe, le fa e kaya e re e gwetlha motsofe wa mokgatlho wa sepolotiki se o leng mo go sona.

en: We need to declare ageism an enemy in public service and government.
tsn: Re tlhoka go bua kgobelelo ya bagodi jaaka sera sa mo tirelong setšhaba le puso.

en: The time for young people is now!
tsn: Nako ya baša ke yona e.

en: I do not believe that when Solomon Mahlangu said we should continue the struggle he meant that we should do exactly what we saw destroying him.
tsn: Ga ke dumele gore fa Solomon Mahlangu a ne a re, re tshwanetse go tswelelapele ka go lwela kgaratlho o ne a sa re, re dire seo se mmolaileng.

en: The enemy we are facing today does not have a specific colour.
tsn: Mmaba o re lebaganeng le ene gompieno ga a na le mmala o o rileng.

en: We need to contest power and challenge ageism everywhere.
tsn: Re tlhoka go ya go lwela kgaisano ya maatla le go gwetlha sa tshwareng kgobelelo ya bagodi gongwe le gongwe.

en: The only way to win is to forcefully and strategically contest and take power.
tsn: Tsela fela ya go fenya ke go pateletsa le go loga maono a kgaisano gore ke kgone go busa.

en: We are dreaming if we think that we are going to be given space by the same people who are responsible for our suffering.
tsn: Ga re akanye sentle fa re solofela gore re tlile go fiwa sebaka ke batho ba ba nang le maikarabelo a go sotlega ga rona.

en: We need to take up space forcefully and strategically so, not by destroying the little that we have.
tsn: Re tlhoka go tsaya sebaka ka go pateletsa le ka go loga maono, e seng ka go senya dilo tse re nang le tsona.

en: Young people are capable, singayisusa nomanini na!
tsn: Baša ba na le bokgoni, ba ka simolola ntwa nako engwe le engwe fa ba batla. singayisusa.

en: By Kabelo Mahlobogwane, businessman, unionist and public speaker.
tsn: Ka Kabelo Mahlobogwane, rrakgwebo, tokololo ya yunioni, mmusakgotla le setšhaba.

en: President Cyril Ramaphosa has announced the launch of the National Pathway Management Network to assist in reducing the countrys high youth unemployment rate.
tsn: Moporesidente Cyril Ramaphosa o begile go tlhomiwa ga tsamaiso ya bosetšhaba ya tsela ya go thusa go fokotsa palo e e kwa godimo ya botlhokatiro jwa bašwa.

en: The initiative brings together eight government departments that will support the youth in finding their way into the economy.
tsn: Tiragatso e, e kopanya mafapha a puso a le robedi go tlaa go tshegetsang baša mo go boneng tiro.

en: Speaking virtually at governments Youth Day event, Ramaphosa says the network will complement governments efforts to create spaces where young people can access information, opportunities and support.
tsn: Ramaphosa o ne a bua kwa moletlong wa puso wa Letsatsi la Bašwa ka kopano ya mafaratlhatlha, mme a re mararang a, a tlile tshegetsa puso ka matsapa a e a tsayang ka go dira mafelo a baša ba ka a dirisang go fitlhelela tshedimosetso, ditšhono le tshegetso.

en: I want to make a call to young South Africans to register on SA YOUTH MOBI, you can create a profile of yourself, view opportunities for learning and earning and receive support through multiple channels.
tsn: Ke batla go dira kopo go baša ba Maaforikaborwa go re ba ikwadise mo SA YOUTH MOBI, o ka kgona go dira porofaele ya gago, go leba ditšhono tsa go ithuta, go amogela le go fitlhela thegetso ka ditsela tse dintsi.

en: SA YOUTH MOBI has been zero-rated by all mobile networks so that it can be accessed by young people across the country at no cost, all you need is a mobile phone or a computer.
tsn: SA YOUTH MOBI e ntse e sa duedisiwe lekgetho la mafaratlhatlha mo mararang otlhe a leng teng, gore tsamayang bašwa naga ka bophara ka bgone go e dirisa kwa ntle ga go duela, se o setlhokang ke go nna le mogala kgotsa ka khompiutara.

en: Youth Day 2021 celebrations:
tsn: Mekete ya Letsatsi la Bašwa la 2021.

en: Earlier, KwaZulu-Natal Premier Sihle Zikalala condemned racial violence at schools.
tsn: Phakela, Tonakgolo ya KwaZulu-Natal Sihle Zikalala a kgalemela Dikgoka mo dikolong.

en: The Premier was one of the speakers at the Youth Day commemorations in Pietermaritzburg.
tsn: Tonakgolo e ne e le mongwe wa dibui tsa  go gokolelwa Letsatsi la Bašwa kwa Pietermaritzburg.

en: Zikalala’s statements follow the violent clash between white and black parents this week at the Witbank Technical High School after a racist incident.
tsn: Dipolelo tsa ga Zikalala di latela dithulano tsa dikgoka magareng ga basweu le batsadi ba Bantsho mo bekeng eno kwa sekolong se se golo sa tsa setegeniki kwa Witbank morago ga tiragalo ya bosemorafe.

en: We note the disappointing incidents of racial intolerance that some of our schools 26 years into democracy.
tsn: Re ela tlhoko dintwa tse di swabisang tsa bosemofare mo dikolong tse dingwe morgo ga dingwaga di le 26 re le ka mo temokerasing.

en: We want to affirm that ours is a truly non-racial society wherein schools in society and in all areas people must enjoy society including access to quality education wherever they want.
tsn: Re batla go tlhomamisa gore setšhaba sa rona ga se setšhaba sa kgethololo mo go sona dikolo mo setšhabeng le mo Motseng ke tsa batho botlhe mme batho ba tshwanetse go ditsena mme re akaretsa phitlhelelo ya thuto ya boleng jo bo kwa godimo go mongwe le mongwe yo a ba batlang.

en: Premier Zikalala speaks to SABC reporter Simphiwe Makhanya.
tsn: Tonakgolo Zikalala o bua le mmegadikgang wa SABC, Simphiwe Makhanya.

en: Zikalala also condemned the attacks against the LGBTQI community following the stabbing, rape and killing of 21-year-old Anele Bengu of KwaMakhuta, south of Durban
tsn: Zikalala o ganeditse gape le dintwa kgatlhanong le ba setšhaba sa LGBTQI, morago ga petelelo, go tlhabiwa le polao ya  Anele Bengu wa dingwaga di le 21 wa go tswa mo  KwaMakhuta, borwa ba Durban.

en: Reflection 45 years on.
tsn: Ditshupo dingwaga di le 45.

en: According to Sport, Arts and Culture, Minister Nathi Mthethwa the country reflects today on whether there has been any progress since the youth took a stand against the apartheid system 45 years ago.
tsn: Go ya ka Tonakgolo ya tsa Metshameko, Botsweretshi le Setso, Nathi Mthethwa naga e lebela fa go nnile le tswelelopele e e diragetseng gompieno marago ga gore bašwa ba eme kgatlhanong le tsamaiso ya tlhaolele dingwaga di le 45 tse di fetileng.

en: Minister Mthethwa speaks to SABC reporter Simphiwe Makhanya.
tsn: Tonakgolo Mthethwa o bua mmegadikgang wa SABC Simphiwe Makhanya.

en: It is through them that we meet 45 years later and reflect on the road which we have traversed since 1994 and asking ourselves questions whether what they fought for whether the stand they took has borne any fruits.
tsn: e ka ga ntlha ya bone re kopana morago ga dingwaga di le 45 re leba tsela e re kileng ra e tsaya  go tloga ka 1994, mme re ipotsisa di potso tsa  gore a se ba se llwetseng le se ba neng ba eme kgatlhanong le sona se re tswetse mosola na.

en: NYDA laments funding crisis at higher education institutions
tsn: NYDA e tlhagisa khutsafalo ya mathata a matlole mo ditheong tsa thuto e kgolwane.

en: National Youth Development Agency CEO Waseem Carrim has lamented the funding crisis young people face at the countrys higher education institutions.
tsn: Waseem Carrim o buile ka mathata a go tlhoka tlamelo ya matlole e baša ba lebaganeng le yona kwa ditheong tsa thuto e kgolwane mo nageng.

en: He was also speaking at governments hybrid Youth Day event.
tsn: O ne a bua ga le kwa moletlong wa puso wa Letsatsi la Bašwa.

en: He says students recurring protests at the beginning of each year must come to an end.
tsn: A re dikhuduego tsa baithuti tsa kwa tshimologong ya ngwaga nngwe le nngwe di tshwanetse go yak wa bokhutlong.

en: Carrim speaks to SABC reporter Simphiwe Makhanya:
tsn: Carrim o bua le mmegadikgang wa SABC Simphiwe Makhanya.

en: It is important to say that young people work hard they struggle through school and they obtain their bachelors passes only to arrive at the gates of higher learning institutions only to be told that there is no money.
tsn: Go botlhokwa go bua gore bašwa ba dira ka natla ba kgaratlha kwa dikolong gore ba falole ka di bachelors fela gore fa ba goroga kwa dihekeng tsa ditheo tsa thuto kgolwne ba bolelelwe gore ga go na madi.

en: Young people gathered under the banner of asinamali, our only crime is to be poor in this country.
tsn: Bašwa ba kopane ka fa tlase ga folaga ya asinamal,  molato wa rona, fela ke go nna dikobo dikhutshwane mo nageng e.

en: We must urgently fast-track the commission on higher education and the task team so that we end the crisis of funding for students so that come 2022 every young person who is academically qualified my have a place at an institution of higher learning.
tsn: Re tshwanetse go dira ka bonako go potlakisa Khomišene ya thuto e kgolwane le setlhopha sa tiro gore re tle re kgone go fedisa mathata a matlole a baithuti gore fa go tlaa 2022 moša mongwe le mongwe yo maduo a gagwe a akateming a mo letlelelang go tsweletsa dithuto tsa gagwepele a fitlhele sebaka kwa setheong sa thuto e kgolwane.

en: Drugs and substance abuse among youth
tsn: Diritibatsi le tirisobotlhaswa ya diritibatsi mo bašeng.

en: Among young people who attended the National Youth Day commemoration in Pietermaritzburg, many say there is hope for the future.
tsn: Mo bašeng ba ba neng ba le teng ka Letsatsi la  ikgopotso la Bašwa la Bosetšhaba kwa Pietermaritzburg, bontsi jwa bona ba re ba na le tsholofelo ya isago.

en: However, there are also fears as more young people are falling victims to drugs and substance abuse.
tsn: E fela, gape go boifiwa gore bašwa ba bantsi ba nna batswasetlhabelo ba diritibatsi le tirisobotlhaswa ya diritibatsi.

en: Prineesa Govender and Mampho Moshoeshoe say their greatest concern is gender-based violence.
tsn: Prineesa Govender le Mampho Moshoeshoe ba re ba tshwengwa thata ke dikgoka tse ikaegileng ka bong.

en: One of the struggles we face is trying to raise ourselves because people dont want to listen to and they think whatever we say will always be wrong.
tsn: Nngwe ya mathata a re lebaneng le o ne ke go leka go ikgodisa ka ntlha ya gore batho ga ba batle go reetsa mme ba akanya gore sengwe le sengwe se re se buang e tlaa tlhola e le phoso.

en: Or it doesnt mean anything, so we would like to empower our voices, and we would like people to listen to what we say.
tsn: Kgotsa ga se reye selo, ka jalo re ka rata go maatlafatsa mantswe a rona, mme re ka rata gore batho ba reetse se re se buang.

en: Because we are the future and we think we will make this country better.
tsn: Ka gonne re ke rona bokamoso mme re akanya gore re tlaa dira gore naga e e nne botoka.

en: My fears about being a young person is the fact that young people these days dont take life seriously.
tsn: Se ke se boifang ka go nna moša ke ntlha ya gore batho ba bašwa mo malatsing ano ga ba tsaye botshele tsia.

en: They just live for the moment.
tsn: Ba tshela fela mo nakong eno.

en: It hurts to see young people wasting their lives drinking.
tsn: Go utlwisa botlhoko go bona bašwa ba senya matshelo a bona ka go nwa bojalwa.

en: Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF) members are gathering at the Horskool Uitsig in Centurion this morning where their leader, Julius Malema is expected to address them as part of Youth Day celebrations.
tsn: Maloko a Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF) ba kopane kwa Sekolong se segolwane sa Uitsig mo mosong ono kwa Centurion, mo moeteledipele wa bona Julius Malema yo a solofetswe go bua le bona jaaka karolo ya Letsatsi la Bašwa.

en: The EFF South Africa will mark Youth Day at Horskool Uitsig in Centurion.
tsn: EFF ya Aforikaborwa e tlaa keteka letsatsi la bašwa kwa sekolong se segolwane sa Uitsig kwa Centurion.

en: This is after a video went viral last week of the pupil being manhandled by a white security guard because the child was wearing EFF regalia as part of career day.
tsn: Se ga se tla morago ga bidio ya go bontsha monna wa mosweu wa matšhikilane a goga goga moithuti mongwe maswe mo bekeng e e fetileng ka ntlha ya gore moithuti yo o ne a apere diaparo tsa EFF jaaka karolo ya tiro ya letsatsi la tselapetlo ya tsa boiphediso.

en: The party chose the school as the venue, following an incident where a learner wearing EFF regalia was allegedly assaulted by a security guard recently.
tsn: Lekoko le tlhophile sekolo se gore se nne lefelo la tirelo, morago ga tiragalo ya gore moithuti a tlhaselwe ke matšhikilane ka go re o ne apere diaparo tsa EFF bošeng jaana.

en: Yesterday, Malema took to Twitter indicating that he will not adhere to the level 3 lockdown restriction announced by President Cyril Ramaphosa last night and will continue with the partys programs in preparation for the October municipal elections.
tsn: Maabane, Malema o begile mo Twitter gore a ka se obamele melao ya mo kgatong ya boraro ya taolelometsamao e e begilweng ke Moporesidente Cyril Ramaphosa maabane bosigo, mme a re o tlaa tswelapele ka mananeo a  lekoko la gagwe a go ipaakanyetsa ditlhopho tsa mmasepala ka di Diphalane.

en: We are proceeding tomorrow.
tsn: Re tswelapele ka moso.

en: You @CyrilRamaphosa can’t call for elections and close the political space.
tsn: Wena @CyrilRamaphosa o ka se batle ditlhopho mme wa tswala phatlha ya sepolotiki.

en: Only fools will listen to stupidity.
tsn: E tlaa nna fela dileele tse di tlaa reetsang bosilo.

en: How do you close once-off political events and allow schools to continue if there's a crises.
tsn: O tswala yang ditiragalo tsa sepolotiki mme wa letla dikolo di bulwe fa e le gore go na le tlaletlo.

en: EFF General Secretary Marshall Dlamini says this commemoration is taking place at this school to showcase that they are not scared to be anywhere in the country.
tsn: Mokwaledi Kakaretso wa EFF Marshall Dlamini a re  ba tlile go keteka letsatsi la se gopotso la bašwa mo sekolong se go bontsha gore ga ba boifi go nna gongwe le gongwe mo nageng ya rona.

en: On a career day, a young man who was wearing EFF regalia showing the aspiration of being an EFF future activist was violently removed from the school by the racist security guard.
tsn: Ka letsatsi la tselapetlo ya tsa boiphediso, mosimane yo a neng  apere diaparo tsa setheo sa EFF go bontsha phisegelo ya go nna molwelakgololosego wa kamoso wa EFF o tlositswe ka dikgoka mo sekolong ke bmosemorafe wa matšhikilane.

en: Because they think they have the authority of where black people must be in this country and dictate our movement, we are here to show them that we are not scared of them.
tsn: Ka ntlha ya gore ba akanya gore ba na le tetla ya gore batho bantsho ba tshwanetse go nna mo nageng e le ke mokgatlho wa rona, re fano go ba bontsha gore ga re a boifa ya bona.

en: Marshall Dlamini speaks to reporter Natasha Phiri:
tsn: Marshall Dlamini o bua le mmegadikgang Natasha Phiri:

en: President Cyril Ramaphosa delivered a virtual keynote address at Youth Day celebrations in Pietermaritzburg, in KwaZulu-Natal, with the event being a hybrid event due to new lockdown regulations.
tsn: Moporesidente Cyril Ramaphosa o neelane ka puokgolo ka tsa mafaratlhatlha kwa moletlong wa Letsatsi la Bašwa kwa Pietermaritzburg, mo kgaolong ya KwaZulu-Natal ka moletlo o, o ne o le ka fa tlase ga melawana e mešwa ya taolelometsamao.

en: South Africans commemorate Youth Day on Wednesday, 16 June.
tsn: Maaforikaborwa go keteka Letsatsi la Bašwa ka Laboraro, 16 Seetebosigo.

en: This day remembers the Soweto youth uprising of June 16, 1976  following a directive from the then Bantu Education Department that Afrikaans had to be used on an equal basis with English as a language of instruction in secondary schools.
tsn: Letsatsi le le gakologelwa di Dikhuduego tsa Bašwa ba Soweto ka 1976 ka di 16 tsa Seetebosigo morago ga go latela kaelo ya Lefapha la Thuto la Bantu gore Seaferikanse se tshwanetse go dirisiwa mo theong e e lekanang le Seesemane jaaka puo ya go ruta mo dikolong tsa sekontari.

en: Pupils from Black schools across the country responded to it with a series of demonstrations.
tsn: Barutwana go tswa mo dikolong tsa Bantsho go ralala naga ba arabile ka go dira ditshupetso ka tatelano.

en: The protests soon turned violent.
tsn: Ditshupetso tse di ne di a fetogela go nna tirisodikgoka ka nako e e sa fediseng pelo.

en: Unofficial figures put the death toll of the protest at 176, while the government said 23 pupils lost their lives that day.
tsn: Palo e e sa kwalwang semmuso e dira palo ya baithuti ba ba  latlhegetswe ke matshelo kwa ditshupetsong e nne 176, fa puso e rile ke baithuti ba le 23 ba ba latlhegetsweng ke matshelo a bona ka letsatsi leo.

en: That generation of young people is lauded for its leadership and bravery in confronting the apartheid regime.
tsn: Kokomana ya bašwa e akgolelwa tiro ya yona ya boeteledipele mo go itebaganya le bogale jwa puso ya tlhaolele.

en: While the current crop of young people has also spearheaded campaigns such as the #FeesMustFall and #RhodesMustFall movements, which some student leaders said was aimed at dismantling the anti-Black system that maintains Black oppression, there have been concerns about a perceived leadership vacuum in the youth space.
tsn: Fa kumo ya jaanong ya bašwa e neng a bolotsa matsholo a mekgatlho jaaka # FeesMustFall #RhodesMustFall,  mo baeteledipele ba bangwe ba baithuti ba re mekgatlho e e ne e batla go fedisa tsamaiso ya Kgatelelo ya Batho Bantsho, go ntse go na le matshwenyego a bonwang mo boeteledipeleng jwa  bašwa.

en: In this special Youth Day podcast, SABC News Producer, Lebo Tshangela, speaks to Political Analyst TK Pooe, Youth Labs Managing Director Pearl Pillay, and Fees Must Fall student leader Mcebo Dlamini about the leadership vacuumBelow is the full podcast:
tsn: Mo kgasong ya letsatsi le la bašwa le le kgethegileng, Montshadikuno wa Dikgang tsa SABC, Lebo Tshangela o bua le modira ditshekatsheko wa dipoletiki TK Pooe, Youth Labs Managing Director Pearl Pillay, le moeteledipele wa baithuti wa Fees Must Fall Mcebo Dlamini ka go tlhaka baeteledipele, kgaso ka botlalo kwa tlase:

en: The State Capture Commission has dismissed AfriForums application to cross-examine ANC President Cyril Ramaphosa because it was outside of the commissions rules.
tsn: Khomišene ya Naga e ganne kopo ya AfriForum ya go botsolotsa Moporesidente wa ANC Cyril Ramaphosa ka gonne e kwa ntle ga melao khomišene.

en: Justice Raymond Zondo says for a person to apply for leave to cross-examine, that person must be implicated by the witness.
tsn: Moatlhodi Raymond Zondo a re gore motho a ka dira kopo ya khunologo go botsolotsa, motho yoo o tshwanetse go ama ke dipaki.

en: AfriForum told Zondo they wanted to question Ramaphosa about cadre deployment and decisions that were taken when he was chairman of the cadre deployment committee.
tsn: AfriForum e boleletse Zondo gore ba ne ba batla go botsa Ramaphosa dipotso ka ga tlhomelo ya setlhopha sa cadre le ditshwetso tse di tserweng fa a ne a le Modulasetulo wa Komiti ya tiriso ya setlhopha cadre

en: AfriForum wants Ramaphosa to answer on ANCs cadre deployment policy:
tsn: AfriForum e batla  gore Ramaphosa a arabe dipotso ka setlhopha sa cadre sa tiriso ya ANC:

en: AfriForum legal counsel, Mia du Plessis, failed to convince Zondo.
tsn: Kgakololo ya semolao ya AfriForum, Mia du Plessis, o reteletswe ke go tlhatswa Zondo.

en: It is the ANC view that the cadre deployment is inconsistent with the view of fairness and transparency and merits in the appointments of individuals to public entities.
tsn: ANC ya re ga e dumelane le mokgwa o setlhopha se tsamaisang dilo ka teng, ba re setlhopha ga sena tshiamo le go baya dilo mo pepeneneng ka maemo a go thapiwa ga batho go ditheo tsa botlhe.

en: When advocate Pretorious proposed to President Ramaphosa there has been evidence that the deployment policy goes far beyond merit, President Ramaphosa denied this and stated that the deployment commission merely recommends.
tsn: Fa Pretorious a ne a tshitshinyetsa Moporesidente Ramaphosa gore go na na le bopaki jwa gore tiriso ya pholisi a ga e tsamaelane le melao, Moporesitente Ramaphosa o ganne se mme a tlhalosa gore khomišene ya go tlhopha e atlenegisa fela.

en: In this regard chair, we would like to hear from President Ramaphosa.
tsn: Mo lebakeng le Modulasetulo, re rata go utlwa go tswa kwa go Moporesidente Ramaphosa.

en: The commission will continue to hear more applications on Wednesday.
tsn: Khomišene e tlaa tswelapele ka go utlwa dikopo di ka Laboraro.

en: State Capture Commission hears applications for leave to cross-examine various witnesses:
tsn: Komišene ya Kgapopuso e reetsa dikopo tsa go tlogela go botsolotsa dipaki tse di farologaneng:

en: President Cyril Ramaphosa has announced that todays Youth Day celebrations in Pietermaritzburg in KwaZulu-Natal will go ahead but will be a hybrid event compliant with level three of the lockdown.
tsn: Moporesidente Cyril Ramaphosa o begile gore Letsatsi la Bašwa la gompieno mo Pietermaritzburg KwaZulu-Natal le tlaa tswelapele mme e tlaa bo e le tiragalo e tlaa o bamela melao ya kgato ya boraro ya taolelometsamao.

en: He announced that the country would enter level three with effect from midnight.
tsn: O begile gore naga ya go tsena mo kgatong ya boraro ya go sekega nakwana ditiro tsa fa nageng go simolola ka bosigogare.

en: SA moves to lockdown level three.
tsn: SA e fudugela kwa kgatong ya boraro go taolelometsamao.

en: The theme for Youth Day this year is The year of Charlotte Maxeke: Growing youth employment for an inclusive and transformed society.
tsn: Setlhogo sa Letsatsi la Bašwa la ngwaga ono ke Ngwaga wa Charlotte Maxeke: Go godisiwa go thapiwa gwa bašwa go akaretsa le jwa setšhaba.

en: President Ramaphosa says there will be a significantly reduced number of people attending the Pietermaritzburg event and he will give a virtual address.
tsn: Moporesitente Ramaphosa a re go tlile go nna palo e e kwa tlase ya batho ba ba tlang go keteka letsatsi la bašwa mo Pietermaritzburg mme ena o tlaa neelana ka puo ka setshwantsho sa tsa mafaratlhatlha.

en: Level three lockdown:
tsn: Kgato ya boraro ya go sekega nakwana ditiro tsa fa nageng:

en: The litmus test for President Ramaphosa’s address to the nations will be what he has to offer the youth.
tsn: Teko ya Litmus ya Moporesitente Ramaphosa ya  go bua le dinaga e tlaa nna se a tshwanetseng go se naya baša.

en: Already the President had said youth unemployment is governments biggest concern.
tsn: Moporesidente o setse a buile gore botlhokatiro jwa bašwa ke tlhababoroko e kgolo ya puso.

en: Two weeks ago, Statistics SA released the national unemployment figures.
tsn: Mo dibekeng tse pedi tse di fetileng, dipalopalo tsa Aforikaborwa (Stats SA) e ntshitse dipalo tsa bosetšhaba tsa botlhokatiro.

en: It painted a dull picture with the official unemployment rate growing to a record high of 32,6 percent.
tsn: E tlhagisitse setshwantsho se se sa itumediseng sa rekoto ya semmuso ya botlhokatiro e e kwa godimo ka diperesente di le 32,6.

en: The population group with the highest unemployment rate is the youth, with 63,3 percent of people between the ages of 15 and 24 being unemployed, and 41,3 percent for the age group 25 and 34.
tsn: Setlhopha se se nang le palo e e kwa godimo go feta kelo ya botlhokatiro ke bašwa, diphesente di le 63,3 ke batho ba ba ka fa gare ga dingwaga di le 15 mme ba di le 24 ba sa dire, mme diphesente di le 41,3  e le setlhopha sa ba dingwaga di le 25 le 34.

en: COVID-19 regulations are to be enforced in Pietermaritzburg for the commemoration.
tsn: Melawana ya Covid-19 e ya go gatelelwa mo Pietermaritzburg ka moletlo wa ikgopotso.

en: The event is expected to have a limited number of guests and key stakeholders, mainly youth.
tsn: Tiragalo eno e solofetswe go na le palo e e lekanyeditsweng ya baeng le baamegi ba ba botlhokwa, bogolo segolo bašwa.

en: Meanwhile, DA Leader John Steenhuisen is expected to address the youth from Mitchells Plain on the Cape Flats during the Partys Youth Day commemorations, encouraging young South Africans to turn up for their future.
tsn: Re sa ntse re le foo, moeteledipele wa DA John Steenhuisen o solofetswe go bua le bašwa go tswa kwa Mitchells Plain mo Cape Flats, mo lekoko la gagwe le ketekang Letsatsi la Bašwa la Lekoko ba maloba, go rotloetsa baša ba Maaforikaborwa gore fetole bokamoso ba bone.

en: However, the event will now have to comply with level three lockdown restrictions.
tsn: Le fa go le jalo, tiragalo e e tlaa tshwanelwa ke go obamela mealo ya kgato ya boraro.

en: Among the issues, Steenhuisen is expected to address is the youth unemployment rate.
tsn: Gareng ga dintlha, Steenhuisen o solofetswe go bua ka botlhokaditiro ga baša.

en: Today is National Youth Day in South Africa, where the country commemorates the June 16 1976 Uprising that began in Soweto and spread across South Africa profoundly changing the socio-political landscape of the country.
tsn: Gompieno ke Letsatsi la Bašwa la Bosetšhaba mo Aforikaborwa, mo naga e dirang segopotso sa Dikhuduego tsa  Seetebosigo 16 1976 kwa Soweto tse di kileng di a anama go kgobaganya Aforikaborwa mme di a fetola thata dipolotiki tsa naga.

en: President Cyril Ramaphosa will deliver the days keynote address virtually at 11:30 am.
tsn: Moporesidente Cyril Ramaphosa o tlile go neelana ka puokgolo ya letsatsi ka tsa mafaratlhatlha ka 11:30 phakela

en: The events, which triggered that uprising in South Africa, can be traced back to policies of the apartheid government that resulted in the introduction of the Bantu Education Act in 1953.
tsn: Ditiragalo tse di simolotseng dikhuduego tsa mo Aforikaborwa, di ka bonwa go tswa go dipholisi tsa puso ya tlhaolele e e dirileng tlhagiso ya Molao wa Thuto ya Bantsho ka 1953.

en: The rise of the Black Consciousness Movement (BCM) and the formation of the South African Students Organisation (SASO) raised the political consciousness of many students, with others joining the older guard political parties of the time.
tsn: Tsibogo ya Black Consciousness Movement (BCM) le go tlhamiwa ga Mokgatlho wa Baithuti wa (South African Student Organisation- SASO) e tsositse go ithuta ka dipolitiki ga baithuti ba le bantsi, go kopana le ba bangwe ka go itisa makoko a sepolotiki.

en: When the apartheid government forced Afrikaans alongside English as a compulsory medium of instruction in schools in 1974, young Black learners began to mobilise.
tsn: Fa puso ya tlhaolele e ne pateletsa tiriso ya Seaforikanse le Seesemane go nna dipuo tsa go ruta kwa dikolong ka 1974, baithuti ba bašwa ba bantsho ba simolotse go bolotsa letsholo.

en: On 16 June 1976, between 3 000 and 10 000 students mobilised by the South African Students Movements Action Committee supported by the BCM marched peacefully to demonstrate and protest against the governments directive.
tsn: Ka di 16 Seetebosigo 1976, baithuti ba ka na 3 000 go ya go 10 000 ba  tlhotlhelediwa ke mokgatlho wa baithuti wa South African Students Movements Action Committee Aforikaborwa ya Komiti ya tiro e e tshegediwang ke BCM ba ne ba gwanta ka kagiso go bontsha le ngongorego kgatlhanong le dipuso kgakololo.

en: While some of them lost their lives, others lived to tell the tale and are serving in various sectors of the countrys economy.
tsn: Fa ba bangwe ba bone ba kile ba latlhegelwa ke matshelo a bona, ba bangwe ba kile ba kgona go tshela mme ba kgona go tlhalosa se diragetseng e bile ba dira mo maphateng a a farologaneng a ikonomi ya naga.

en: As the country reflects on the events of that day and the victory that followed, SABC Digital News highlights three of the many leaders who emerged from the uprising.
tsn: Jaaka naga e gopola ditiragalo tsa letsatsi leo le phenyo e e nnileng teng, Dikgang tsa maratlhatlha tsa  SABC di tlhagisa baeteledipele ba bararo ba kileng ba tlhagelela go tswa mo dikhuduegong.

en: Below is a brief summary of them:
tsn: Fa tlase ke tshoboko e khutswane ya bona:

en: The State Capture Commission is listening to implicated parties applications for leave to cross-examine those who have accused them of wrongdoing.
tsn: Khomišhine ya Puso e reeditse dikopo tsa go tlogela go botsolotswa  tsa makoko a a amegang  mo bonweng  ba molato wa tlolomolao.

en: Below are the proceedings:
tsn: Fa tlase ke mananeo:

en: African National Congress (ANC) Deputy Secretary-General, Jessie Duarte, has received a memorandum of demands from protesting ANC workers.
tsn: Motlatsa Mokwaledi-Kakaretso wa African National Congress (ANC), Jessie Duarte, o amogetse Memorantamo ditopo tsa badiri ba ANC ba ba neng dira ditshupetso.

en: ANC employees have been picketing outside the party offices across the country, including Luthuli House in Johannesburg, over the party’s failure to pay salaries.
tsn: Badiri ba ANC ba ntse ba dira tshupetso kwa ntle ga dikantoro tsa lekoko go ralala naga, go akaretsa le Ntlo ya Luthuli (Luthuli House) mo Johannesburg,ka ntlha ya gore lekoko le, le go retelelwa ke go duela dituelo.

en: Demonstrators say they haven’t been paid their May salary which is now over 20 days late.
tsn: Badiraditshupetso ba re ga baise ba duelwe tuelo ya bone ya kgwedi ya Motsheganong, e jaanong e leng kwa morago ga malatsi a le 20.

en: Employees at @MYANC Headquarters Luthuli House are picketing over the party’s failure to pay salaries.
tsn: Badiri ba kwa Mošate wa @MYANC kwa Luthuli House ba dira ditshupetso ka ntlha gore lekoko le retelelwa ke go duela dituelo.

en: Duarte addressed members, saying negotiations will continue.
tsn: Duarte o buile maloko a lekoko, a re ditherisano di tlile go tswelapele.

en: No salaries will be reduced and if we need, at all, to undergo any restructuring it will be with you and you will be part of the decision that we take.
tsn: Ga gona dituelo tse di tlileng go fokodiwa mme fa e le gore re tshwanetse go ya ka mo kago sešwa, e tlile go nna le wena  mme o tlile go nna karolo ya ditshwetso tse re di tsayang.

en: We thank you for conducting the picket and raising your concerns in a disciplined manner.
tsn: Re lebogela go dira ditshupetso ga lona le go tlhagisa matshwenyego a lona ka boitshwaro.

en: We call on ANC members to continue with their constructive engagement until all the matters you have raised are resolved.
tsn: Re ikuela mo malokong a ANC go tswelela ka dipuisano tsa bone tse di tswang mosola go nna le seabe se go fitlhela go rarabololwa ditsitsibo tsotlhe tse di tlhagisitsweng.

en: So we will continue with the negotiations and continue to discuss, says Duarte.
tsn: Ka jalo re tlile go tswelapele ka dipuisano le go tswelapele ka go boledisana, ga bua jalo duarte.

en: Chairperson of the ANC Staff Representative in the Western Cape, Mvusi Mdala, says they are giving the employer a week to respond to their demands.
tsn: Vusi Mdala Modulasetulo wa Badiri wa mokgatlho wa ANC mo Kapabophirima, Mvusi Mdala a re ba naya mothapi  beke go tsibogela ditlhokego tsa bona.

en: Part of our demands is that the employer is not paying the provident fund, whereas they are deducting money from us as employees, and also is not paying UIF, whereas they are deducting money from us, continuously our medical aid is being suspended, even today our good morning was a message from the medical aid indicating to us that our medical aid has been suspended, explains Mdala.
tsn: E nngwe ya dilopo tsa rona ke gore mothapi ga a duele Letlole la dituelo tsa badiri, mme ba ntsha madi go tswa mo go rona jaaka badiri, ka fa thuso ya kalafi ya rona e ya sekegwa nako le nako, le gompieno re tsoswa ke molaetsa wa thuso ya kalafi o o re bontshang gore thuso ya kalafi ya rona e sekegilwe, go bua Mdala.

en: The workers say late payments have been happening for the last 10 years.
tsn: Badiri ba re go duelwa thari go ntse go diragala mo dingwageng tse lesome tse di fetileng.

en: Earlier on Tuesday, ANCs Treasurer-General, Paul Mashatile, admitted that the governing party is facing financial constraints, which are exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic.
tsn: Go sa le gale ka Labobedi, motsholamatlotlokakaretso wa ANC, Paul Mashatile o amogetse gore lekoko le le busang le lebane le mathata a ditšhelete, mme a okeditswe ke leroborobo la covid-19.

en: Mashatile says the party has lost most of its funders:
tsn: Mashatile a re lekoko le latlhegetswe baetleetsi ba bantsi:

en: As COVID-19 infections continue to rapidly increase and with fears that the country is officially on a third wave, President Cyril Ramaphosa will be locked in several meetings on Tuesday in a bid to find a better response to the pandemic.
tsn: Jaaka ditshwaetso tsa Covid-19 ditswelela go oketsega ka lebelo le go boifa gore naga ya rona e tsene mo kgatong ya bararo ka semmuso,  Moporesidente Cyril Ramaphosa o tlitle go tshwara dikopano di le mmalwa ka Labobedi ka maiteko a go bona tsibogo e e botoka .

en: South Africa is on Alert Level two of the national lockdown.
tsn: Aforikaborwa e mo kgatong ya bobedi ya tsaolelometsamo ya naga

en: But it seems regulations under this level are failing to curb the fast-increasing number of infections.
tsn: Fela go bontsha e kete melawana e e ka fa tlase ga kgato ya e, e palelwa ke go fokotsa  palo e e o koketsegang ka lebelo ya ditshwaetsego.

en: For the past seven days, the country recorded COVID-19 infections well over 20 000 prompting government to take action.
tsn: Mo malatsing a le supa a a fitileng, naga e rekotile ditshwaetsego di ka fetang 20 000 tsa Covid-19 di tlhotlholetsa puso go tsaya kgato .

en: COVID-19 weekly stats with Dr Ridhwaan Suliman:
tsn: Dipalopalo tsa Covid-19 tsa beke le beke, ka Ngaka Ridhwaan Suliman:

en: Today, President Ramaphosa will have back-to-back meetings to respond to the fast-increasing numbers.
tsn: Gompieno, Moporesitente Ramaphosa o tlile go nna le dikopano tse di salaneng morago back-to-back go tsibogela dipalo tse di o ketsegang ka lebelo.

en: Firstly later this morning, he will convene a meeting of the National Coronavirus Command Council where the Department of Health will make a presentation.
tsn: Sa ntlha moragonyana mo mosong o, o tla bitsa kopano ya Khansele ya Bosetšhaba ya Coronavirus mo lefapha la boitekanelo le tlaa dirang tlhagiso.

en: Later in the day, he will preside over the meeting of all Premiers and in the afternoon he will chair the Cabinet.
tsn: Moragonyana mo letsatsing, o tla okamela kopano ya Ditonakgolo tsotlhe mme maitseboa o tlile go tshwara kopano le Kabinete.

en: At the end of all these meetings, the President may be expected to update the nation on a day still to be communicated.
tsn: Kwa bokhutlong jwa dikopano tsotlhe tse, Moporesidente o folofelwa go bua le setšhaba mo malatsing go sa itsisiwe gore le le feng.

en: Latest SA Stats loading.
tsn: Dipalopalo tsa SA tsa Bošeng jaana di a latela.

en: The African National Congress (ANC) Treasurer-General Paul Mashatile has admitted that the governing party is facing financial constraints which are exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic.
tsn: Motsholamatlotlokakaretso wa African National Congresss (ANC) Paul Mashatile o amogetse gore lekoko le le busang e lebane le mathata a ditšhelete a a okeditsweng ke leroborobo la Covid-19.

en: On Tuesday, ANC staff members will embark on a nationwide picket at lunchtime, over the partys failure to pay salaries on time.
tsn: Ka Labobedi Maloko a badiri ba African National Congress (ANC) ba tlile go tsena mo letong la go dira dishupetso tsa naga ka bophara ka nako ya dijo tsa motshegare, ka ntlha ya gore lekoko le reteletswe ke go duela dituelo tsa bona ka nako.

en: The ANC has been experiencing financial problems with reports that it owes the South African Revenue Service (SARS) R80 million in Pay As You Earn (PAYE) deductions.
tsn: ANC e itemogela mathata a ditšhelete mme go begwa gore e kolota madirelo wa Aforikaborwa wa Makgetho (SARS) madi a kana ka dimilone di le 80 tsa di ranta tsa Pay As You Earn (PAYE) ya dikgogo tsa madi.

en: The party is also in arrears by at least 28 months or around R140 million on its provident fund, which is deducted from workers salaries.
tsn: Gape lekoko le dikolotong tsa madi a dikgwedi di le 28 kgotsa madi a ka nna dimilione di le 140 tsa diranta mo go letlole la pabalelo, e ntshiwang mo dituelong tsa badiri.

en: Dozens of protesting workers are expected to hand over their memorandum of demands at the partys headquarters, Luthuli House, in Johannesburg on Tuesday.
tsn: Badiri ba bantsi ba ba dirang ditshupetso ba solofetswe go bonwa  baya kwa mošate wa lekoko, Luthuli House kwa Johannesburg, mo ba tlileng go isa memorantamo wa dilopo tsa bone ka Labobedi.

en: Mashatile says the party has lost most of its funders.
tsn: Mashatile a re lekoko le latlhegetswe ke baetleetsi ba bantsi.

en: We are struggling with cash flow, the ANC has never really had an abundance of cash, weve always got money from donors and since the pandemic funding has been coming very slow because companies are not doing so well.
tsn: Lekoko le a tlhaka ka madi a seatleng, ANC ga ise e nne le madi a mantsi,  madi a mantsi a lekoko a ne atswa go baabi mme jaanong ka ntlha ya leroborobo baabi ga ba sa  re abela ka gonne dikgwe ga di sa dira thata. a ya leroborobo gore go ne go na le bontsi jwa madi a a seatleng,...... weve...... Ka gale go na le madi go tswa go baabi le fa e sa le leroborobo la thuso ya matlole e e tlang e bonya thata ka ntlha ya gore ba dire jalo.

en: Some of them have closed down.
tsn: Dingwe tsa tsona di ne di a tswalwa.

en: It’s a difficult environment
tsn: Ke tikologo e e thata

en: But we do try our best to raise funds
tsn: Fela re a leka ka bojotlhe jwa rona go oketsa matlole

en: Sometimes we get funding a bit late
tsn: Ka dinako tse dingwe re fitlhela tlamelo ya matlotlo go le thari nyana.

en: and we end up paying salaries late.
tsn: Mme re feletsa re duela dituelo thari.

en: He adds: In the current economic environment it has not been easy to get any evidence most of our investments are also affected.
tsn: O ne a oketsa ka gore: Mo seemong sa ikonomi sa jaanong go ne go se motlhofo go nna le bosupi jwa bontsi jwa dipeeletso tsa rona gape di amegang.

en: But there is another problem now: the new act which requires disclosure beyond 100k you donate to a political party you must disclose so some people are uncomfortable with that
tsn: Mme go na le bothata jo bongwe jaanong: Molao o mošwa o tlhoka gore o senole fa o  abela lekoko ka madi a go feta dikete tsa makgolo a diranta (100k) mme batho  bangwe ga ba itumelele seo.

en: so they are slowly pulling back and we do struggle in that regard.
tsn: Ka jalo ba ikgogela morago ka bonya mme re a kgaratlha ka ntlha eo.

en: In the video below, ANC Deputy Secretary-General Jessie Duarte confirmed a month ago that the party is facing financial problems:
tsn: Ka mo bidiong fa e e tlase, Motlatsa Mokwaledi-Kakaretso wa ANC Jessie Duarte o netefaditse kgwedi e e fetileng gore lekoko lebane le mathata a matlotlo.

en: African National Congress (ANC) staff members will embark on a nationwide picket at lunch-time on Tuesday, over the governing partys failure to pay their salaries on time.
tsn: Maloko a badiri ba African National Congress (ANC) ba tlile go tsena mo letong la go dira dishupetso naga ka bophara ka nako ya dijo tsa motshegare ka Labobedi, ka ntlha ya gore lekoko le retelelwa ke go duela dituelo tsa bona ka nako.

en: The ANC has been experiencing financial problems with reports that it owed the South African Revenue Service (SARS) R80 million in Pay As You Earn deductions.
tsn: ANC e ntse itemogela mathata a matlole, ka dipegelo tse di reng, e kolota madirelo a Aforikaborwa a Makgetho (SARS) madi a ka nna dimilone di 80 tsa di ranta tsa Pay As You Earn (PAYE) ya dikgogo tsa madi.

en: In the video below ANC Treasurer-General Paul Mashatile explained how the party was planning to raise some funds.
tsn: Mo bidiong e e fa tlase Motsholamatlotlokakaretso Paul Mashatile o tlhalositse gore lekoko le ya go kgobokantsha matlole a mang jang.

en: The party was also in arrears by at least 28 months or around R140 million on its provident fund which was deducted from workers’ salaries.
tsn: Lekoko le ne le saletse kwa morago ka madi ka dikgwedi di ka nna 28 kgotsa dimilione di ka nna 140 tsa diranta tse di neng di gogwa go tswa mo dituelong ts madiri.

en: Dozens of protesting workers are expected to hand over their memorandum of demands at the partys headquarters, Luthuli House in Johannesburg.
tsn: Badiri ba bantsi ba solofetswe go bonwa ba isa memorantamo wa bone kwa Luthuli House mošate wa lekoko kwa Johannesburg.

en: ANC spokesperson Pule Mabe says they have encouraged all their provincial leaders to receive memoranda from workers.
tsn: Mmueledi wa ANC Pule Mabe a re o rotloeditse baemedi botlhe ba bone ba di porofense go amogela memorantamo yo o tswang mo badiring.

en: ANC statement on staff salary payments.
tsn: Polelo ANC ka tuelo ya badiri.

en: In 2020, the ANC blamed the COVID-19 pandemic for its failure to pay staff salaries.
tsn: Ka 2020 ANC e ne e supa leroborobo la COVID-19 ka monwana ka ntlha ya gore e ne e retelelwa ke go duela badiri dituelo.

en: The Electoral Commission (IEC) has issued a reminder that this is the final week for public comment on the inquiry to ensure free and fair elections during COVID-19.
tsn: Khomišene ya Ditlhopho (IEC) e ntshitse tsiboso ya gore, beke e, ke  beke ya bofelo ya gore setšhaba se dire tshwaelo ka ga tsheko, go netefatsa gore go na le ditlhopho tse di gololosegileng e bile di siame ka nako ya Covid-19.

en: South Africans are scheduled to go to the polls in local government elections in October.
tsn: Maaforikaborwa a rulaganyeditswe go ya kwa ditlhopong tsa pusoselegae ka kgwedi ya Diphalane.

en: However there have been some calls for the elections to be postponed until the pandemic has subsided.
tsn: E fela, go ntse go na le dipuo tsa gore ditlhopho di tshwanetse go busediwa morago go fitlhilela leroborobo le  fokotsega.

en: Launch of 2021 municipal elections:
tsn: Tshimololo ya ditlhopho tsa mmasepala tsa 2021:

en: The inquiry is headed by Justice Dikgang Moseneke.
tsn: Tsheko e e eteletswe pele ke Moatlhodi Dikgang Moseneke.

en: People can give their opinions by emailing freeandfiar@elections.org.za or sending a voice note to 063 863 4623.
tsn: Batho ba ka ntsha maikutlo a bona ka romela molaetsa mo emailing ya freeandfiar@elections.org.za kgotsa ka go romela molaetsa wa lentswe le le gatisitsweng mo go 063 863 4623.

en: Submissions must be made by this Friday.
tsn: Ditlhagiso di tshwanetse go dirwa pele ga Labotlhano le.

en: Earlier this month the IEC Chief Electoral Officer, Sy Mamabolo said the 2021 upcoming Local Government Elections (LGE)will be the most complex in the history of democratic South Africa.
tsn: Mo tshimologong ya kgwedi e, Motlhankedi-mogolo wa ditlhopho tsa IEC, Sy Mamabolo o rile ditlhopho tsa dipusoselegae (LGE) tsa 2021 di tlile go nna tse di matswakabele, mo hisetoring ya temokerasi ya Aforikaborwa.

en: He told guests at the launch of the Municipal Elections, that they are expecting more than 10 000 councilors to be elected into the different municipalities across the country.
tsn: O ne a bolelela baeng ka nako ya tlhomelo ya ditlhophong tsa bommasepala, gore ba folofetse bomokhanselara ba ba ka fetang 10 000 go ka tlhophiwa go nna bakhanselara mo  Bommasepala ba ba farologaneng go ralala naga.

en: Mamabolo added that this years Local Government Elections tag line is Every Voice Together which underlines the possibilities for South Africa where every voice comes together.
tsn: Mamabolo o tlhalosa gore Ditlhopho tsa ngwago ona tsa Pusoselegae di bopilwe ka puo ya gore “Every Voice Together” mme ya re tshwaya dintlha tsa kgonagalo tsa Aforikaborwa mo  batho ba tlang mmogo.

en: Municipal Elections involve 4 725 unique elections and thus unique ballot paper configuration consisting of the following.
tsn: Ditlhopho tsa mmasepala go di nna le ditlhopho di le 4 725 tse di maleba mme ka jalo pampiritlhopho e e maleba e bopilwe ka tse di latelang.

en: 4 468 ward elections, 205 municipality elections in council and eight PR elections in metro councils and 44 district council elections across the country, Mamabolo explained.
tsn: Ditlhopho tsa Diwoto di ka nna ka 4 468, ditlhopho di le 205 tsa masepala tsa dikhanselara le ditlhopho di le robedi tsa PR tsa dikhansele tsa ditoropokgolo, le ditlhopho di le 44 tsa dikhansele tsa go ralala naga, Mamabolo a tlhalosa.

en: The Al Jamah political party is calling on President Cyril Ramaphosa to place the country back to Level 5 of the lockdown even if its for one or two weeks.
tsn: Lekoko la dipolotiki la AL Jamah le ikuela Moporesidente Cyril Ramaphosa go baya naga mo kgatong ya botlhano ya go sekega nakwana ditiro tsa ka  fa nageng le fa e ka nna beke kgotsa dibeke di le pedi.

en: This comes as the country enters the third wave of coronavirus infections with daily new infections rising steeply in a number of provinces.
tsn: Se se tla jaaka naga e tsena mo kgatong ya boraro ya ditshwaetsego tsa coronavirus tse di oketsegang thata letsatsi le letsatsi mo diporofenseng tse di rileng.

en: Al Jamah Leader, Ganief Hendricks, says the country still remains in a coronavirus war zone.
tsn: Moeteledipele  wa Al Jamah Ganief Hendricks, a re naga e santse e le mo ntweng e kgolo ya coronavirus.

en: Hendricks also wants the sale of alcohol and cigarettes to be prohibited.
tsn: Hendricks o batla gape gore thekiso ya bojalwa le disekerete e dumelesege.

en: Al Jamah still feels today that we are in a war situation.
tsn: Al Jamah o sa ntse a utlwa re sa le mo ntweng le gompieno.

en: For the past year, we supported the president with regards to each time of extending the state of Disaster, and we still supporting the President wherever we can.
tsn: Mo ngwageng o o fetileng, re tshegeditse moporesidente ka di nako tsotlhe fa a ne a oketsa maemo a matlhotlhapelo a naga, mme re sa ntse re tshegetsa moporesidente ka fa re ka kgonang.

en: We are now in the third wave and people are dying like flies.
tsn: Jaanong re mo kgatong ya boraro ya phudugelo mme batho ba swa jaaka dintsi.

en: And we feel that the President must ignore the official opposition party (DA) and focus on only saving lives.
tsn: Mme re dumela gore Moporesidente a sa reetsa lekokokganetso la semmuso (DA) mme a tlhome mogopolo wa gagwe fela mo go bolokeng matshelo.

en: And he shouldn’t worry about saving livelihoods because we are in a war situation.
tsn: Mme a sa tshwenyega ka ga go boloka matseno a batho, ka gonne re ne re le mo ntweng.

en: We cannot let lives be lost just to save an extra job or two.
tsn: Re ka se kgone go letlela batho ba latlhegelwa ke matshelo fela go boloka tiro kgotsa ditiro tsa bone.

en: So, Al Jamah’s position is that there should be a complete lockdown that we must move to level five, maybe just for a week or two, and secondly, there must be a complete alcohol ban because it has been proven that alcohol is causing much harm.
tsn: Ka jalo Jamah o bona go tshwanetse gore re nne mo kgatong ya botlhano ya go sekega nakwana ditiro tsa fa nageng, gongwe fela ka beke kgotsa tse pedi, mme sa bobedi, ke gore go netefatswe gore thekeiso ya bojalwa ga ya letlelelwa ka ntlha ya gore nnotagi e tlisa kotsi e ntsi thata.

en: And the President has given into the captains of the wine industry and that was the big mistake.
tsn: Mme Moporesidente o reeditse balaedi ba bodirelo jwa beine mme seo e ne e le phoso e kgolo.

en: We also feel that there must be a ban on cigarettes just like it was in level five.
tsn: Gape re akanya gore go tshwanetse ga nna thibelo ya thekiso ya disekerete fela jaaka e ne e le teng mo kgatong ya botlhano.

en: So we are in a war situation and we need to throw everything at defeating the pandemic, says Hendricks.
tsn: Hendricks a re, re mo ntweng, ka jalo re tlhoka go dira sengwe le sengwe se se ka fenyang leroborobo le.

en: President Ramaphosa raises concern about a possible third wave of coronavirus infections in SA:
tsn: Moporesitente Ramaphosa o bontsha go tshwenyega ka ntlha ya gore go na le kgonego ya  go bona lekhubu la boraro la ditshwaetsego tsa mpogare wa corona mo Aforikaborwa:

en: The state has now added a charge of racketeering to the charge sheet of the former eThekwini Mayor, Zandile Gumede, and her 21 co-accused.
tsn: Puso jaanong e okeditse melato ka go lokela molato wa bogodu melatong ya mmeyara wa pele wa eThekwini, Zandile Gumede, le balotafadiwammogo ba gagwe ba le 21.

en: The amended indictment was handed in when Gumede, eThekwini Municipal Manager, Sipho Nzuza, other officials, four councillors, and eight business people appeared in the Durban High Court.
tsn: Molato wa tatofatsoe o o tlhabolotsweng o ne wa tlisiwa fa Gumede, le Motsamaisi wa mmasepala wa eThekwini, Sipho Nzuza, le batlhankedi ba bangwe, le bakhanselara ba le bane le borra kgwebo ba le robedi ba tlhagelela kwa kgotlatshekelo e e kwa godimo ya Durban.

en: Other charges include fraud and corruption.
tsn: Ditatofatso tse dingwe di akaretsa tsa tsietso ya madi le bonweenwee.

en: The case stems from a 2017 Durban Solid Waste tender of over R400 million.
tsn: Kgetse e, e simolola kwa thendareng ya matlakala ya Durban ya dimilione tsa di ranta di le 400 ka 2017.

en: NPA Spokesperson, Natasha Kara, says the case has been postponed to give the defence a chance to request further particulars.
tsn: Mmueledi wa NPA, Natasha Kara, a re kgetse e buseditswe morago go neela baemedi ba tshireletso tetla ya go kopa dintlha tse dingwe.

en: Based on this amended indictment and the court has given a date of 30th of November.
tsn: Go ya ka molato wa tatofatsoe o o tlhabolotsweng, kgotlatshekelo e ntshitse letlha la di 30 Ngwanaitseele.

en: By that time we anticipate that the state would have responded to the requests for further particulars.
tsn: Ka nako eo, re solofela gore puso e tlaa bo e e tsibogetse dikopo tsa dintlha tse dingwe.

en: What was also important today was that the matter was set down for the possible trial date of 18 July 2022.
tsn: Se se neng se le botlhokwa thata gompieno e ne e le gore kgetse e ne ya beelwa letlha la tsheko la di 18 tsa Phukwi 2022.

en: NPA says it is ready for trial against the former eThekwini mayor:
tsn: NPA ya re ekemiseditse tsheko ya kgatlhanong le mmeyara wa maloba, wa eThekwini.

en: The fraud and corruption trial of former eThekwini Mayor Zandile Gumede is expected to start on July 18, 2022 in the Durban High Court.
tsn: Tsheko ya tsietso le bonweenwee ya mmeyara wa maloba wa eThekwini, Zandile Gumede e solofetswe go simolola ka di 18 tsa Phukwi 2022 kwa kgotlatshekelokgolo ya Durban.

en: Gumede is being charged together with 21 other accused which include business people, councillors and municipal officials.
tsn: Gumede o latofadiwa mmogo le balatofadiwa ba le 21 ba akaretsa batho ba dikgwebo, bakhanselara le batlhankedi ba masepala.

en: The case stems from a Durban Solid Waste tender of over R400 million in 2017.
tsn: Kgetse e, e simolola kwa thendareng ya matlakala ya Durban ya dimilione tsa di ranta di le 400 ka 2017.

en: The court has postponed the case to November 30 for another pre-trial hearing.
tsn: Kgotlatshekelo e boseditse kgetse kwa morago go nna ka di 30 tsa Ngwanaitseele gore go nne le dikgato tsa pele ga tsheko.

en: Gumede has appeared at the Durban High Court:
tsn: Gumede o tlhageletse kwa kgotlatshekelokgolo ya Durban:

en: In March, it was reported that according to the indictment the State listed Robert Abbu, accused number one, amongst the key role players.
tsn: Ka kgwedi ya Mopitlwe, go ne gwa begwa gore go ya ka molato wa tatofatsoe o o tlhabolotsweng, puso e dirile Rober Abbu molatofadiwa wa ntlha mo lenaaneng, gareng ga batsayakarolo ba bangwe.

en: Former supply chain manager at the eThekwini Municipality Sandile Ngcobo, senior African National Congress (ANC)councillor Mondli Mthembu, former eThekwini Mayor Zandile Gumede and suspended eThekwini City Manager Sipho Nzuza are also listed as key players in the matter.
tsn: Motsamasi wa maloba wa mokoloko wa dithebolelo wa kwa eThekwini Sandile Ngcobo, le motlhankedimogolo wa African National Congress (ANC) mokhanselara Mondli Mthembu, le mmeyara wa maloba wa eThekwini Zandile Gumede, le Motsamaisi wa Toropo ya eThekwini yo a sekegilweng Sipho Nzuza le bona ba kwadilwe mo lenaaneng la batsayakarolo mo kgannyeng eno.

en: Details contained in the indictment state that Abbu, in 2017, was appointed by Nzuza as Head of Special Projects without following proper procedures, a position that the State alleges had not previously existed.
tsn: Dintlha tse di leng mo molatong wa tatofatsoe o o tlhabolotsweng,  di tlhagisa gore ka 2017  Abbu, ka 2017, o ne a tlhomiwa ke Nzuza jaaka tlhogo ya diporojeke tse di kgethegileng kwa ntle ga go latela dithulaganyo tse di siameng, phatlhatiro e e puso e reng e ne e se teng kwa mathomong.

en: As the country celebrates Youth Day on Wednesday, President Cyril Ramaphosa has acknowledged that the struggles of South Africas youth are many.
tsn: Jaaka naga e keteka letsatsi la bašwa ka Laboraro, Moporesidente Cyril Ramaphosa o amogela gore dikgaratlho tsa bašwa mo Aforikaborwa di dintsi.

en: In his weekly letter to the nation, Ramaphosa says the greatest struggle young people wage is against unemployment, worsened under the COVID-19 pandemic.
tsn: Lekwalo la moporesidente Ramaphosa la beke le beke, la re kgaratlho e kgolo e bašwa ba lwanang le yona ke botlhokatiro, jo bo oketseging ka fa tlase ga leroborobo la Covid-19.

en: He says creating more opportunities and supporting young people to access these is governments foremost priority.
tsn: A re go tlhola ditšhono tse dintsi le go ema nokeng bašwa gore ba kgone go di fitlhela, ke setlape sa puso.

en: President Ramaphosa has expressed concern about the diminishing awareness of the events of June 16, 45 years ago amongst the so-called Generation Z born after 1997.
tsn: Moporesitente Ramaphosa o tlhagisitse go tshwenyega ka ntlha ya gonyatsiwa ga temoso ya ditiragalo tsa Seetebosigo 16, dingwaga di le 45 tse di fetileng magareng ga se se bidiwang Generaation Z e e  belegweng morago ga 1997.

en: He says society has a collective responsibility to ensure the message of that day and the sacrifices of the 1976 generation are not lost.
tsn: A re setšhaba se na le maikarabelo a go netefatsa gore molaetsa wa letsatsi le la le ditlhabelo di tse dirilweng bašwa ba 1976 ga di lebalwe.

en: Ramaphosa says tackling youth unemployment requires accelerating economic growth, particularly in labour-intensive sectors, and building the capability of the state to fulfil its developmental role.
tsn: Ramaphosa a re go samagana le botlhokatiro ga bašwa bo tlhoka ikonomi e  e golang ka bonako, bogolosegolo mo maphateng a dithoto le ditirelo, le go aga bokgoni ba naga ba go dira se.

en: He says government will this week launch a range of additional measures to create opportunities for the youth.
tsn: A re puso mo bekeng e tlile go simolola motseletsele wa tlaleletso go tlhola ditšhono tsa bašwa.

en: South Africa’s unemployment rate hits new all-time high.
tsn: Botlhokatiro jwa mo Aforikaborwa bo ile kwa godimo thata lwa ntlha.

en: Final preparations are being made to an area outside the Durban High Court where supporters of former eThekwini Mayor Zandile Gumede will gather.
tsn: Dipaakanyo tsa bofelo di direlwa ko karolong e engwe kwa ntle ga kgotlatshekelokgolo yak wa Durban mo baemanokeng ba mmeyara wa maloba, wa eThekwini Zandile Gumede  ba tlaa kapanang teng.

en: Gumede and 21 other accused are due to appear in court on Monday, on charges of fraud and corruption in connection with a Durban Solid Waste tender of over R400 million in 2017.
tsn: Gumede le molatofadiwa ba bangwe ba ba 21 ba tlile go tlhagelela kwa kgotlatshekelo ka Mosupologo, ka ditatofatso tsa tsietso le bonweenwee malebana le thendara ya Durban ya matlakala ya dimilione tsa diranta di le 400 ka 2017.

en: Case against Zandile Gumede and 21 others moved to the Durban High Court.
tsn: Kgetse kgatlhanong le Zandile Gumede le balotafadiwa ba bangwe ba le 21 e isitswe kwa Kgotlatshekelokgolo ya Durban

en: The tent and stage where supporters will wait outside court has been set up.
tsn: Tente e le sefata tse baemanokeng ba tlaa emang mo go tsone kwa pele ga kgotlatshekelo di setse ditlhomilwe

en: Security has been beefed up around the High Court.
tsn: Baadisa ba tshireletso ba setse ba me mo tikologong ya kgotlatshekelokgolo.

en: Spokesperson for Gumede supporters Ntando Khuzwayo says the group outside court will abide by COVD-19 regulations.
tsn: Mmueledi wa baemanokeng ba Gumede, Ntando Khuzwayo a re setlhopha se se kwa ntle ga kgotlatshekelo se tlile go obamela melawana ya Covd-19.

en: Meanwhile, in March it was reported that according to the indictment, the State listed Robert Abbu, accused number one, amongst the key role players.
tsn: Re sa ntse re le foo, ka kgwedi ya Mopitlwe go ne gwa begwa gore go ya ka molato wa tatofatsoe o o tlhabolotsweng, Puso beile Robert Abbu wa ntlha mo lenaaneng la balotafadiwa, mo gare ga batsayakarolo ba ba farologaneng.

en: Former supply chain manager at the eThekwini Municipality Sandile Ngcobo, senior African National Congress (ANC)councillor Mondli Mthembu, former eThekwini Mayor Zandile Gumede and suspended eThekwini City Manager Sipho Nzuza are also listed as key players in the matter.
tsn: Motsamasi wa maloba wa mokoloko wa dithebolelo wa kwa eThekwini Sandile Ngcobo, le motlhankedimogolo wa African National Congress (ANC) mokhanselara Mondli Mthembu, le mmeyara wa maloba wa eThekwini Zandile Gumede, le Motsamaisi wa Toropo ya eThekwini yo a sekegilweng Sipho Nzuza le bona ba kwadilwe mo lenaaneng la batsayakarolo mo kgannyeng eno.
